review: I love this place.  I probably could eat here every day.  We find them all over this state and know we can always rely on delicious fresh made food! Must try the carne asada pizza.  Omg! Thai pizza delicious.  Red Velvet cake is the best I've ever had.   The BBQ chopped chicken salad is perfect. Thee eggrolls are yummy.   See I told you I love this place!

We went here in the early afternoon and it was not busy at all. The customer service was perfect, everyone was super nice and our food was delivered quickly.  I highly recommend trying the butter cake with ice cream! It looked plain but what surprisingly good. I'd best describe it as a sugar-cookie cake, and I'm not even a huge fan of sugar cookies.  I will definitely be back in here again.

I visited today with a friend for lunch - it was my first  time at  the Valencia location.  We arrived at about 11:30am and the place was mostly empty and the music was far too LOUD. I was also underwhelmed with the architecture; the CPK in Burbank is far more charming. The space here in Valencia felt like a big rectangular box. I ordered split pea soup (our server volunteered that this  only vegan option for soup, not that I cared because I'm not vegan - but it was very good and included barley and carrots in the recipe) and the spinach salad that included apples, pecans, and quinoa. Both were exceptionally good, as was the passion fruit mango iced tea. Honestly though, $3.29 for iced tea? That's a bit outrageous.  The service was very good and the staff was attentive without being annoying. I like that, so I'll go back, but I'll just have water.

I used to frequent this location quite a bit when I worked in the area. It's a great place to meet friends for lunch and relax. I ordered a salad with an individual pizza loaded with veggies. The veggies were fresh as well as the other ingredients. However, there wasn't enough cheese or sauce on the pizza. It was like eating veggies on pizza crust.  The side salad was okay. I can't remember the exact name of the salad but it's a common salad served at many restaurants. The service was good. There's nothing overly spectacular about California Pizza Kitchen. It's a nice place to meet friends and eat food that's just okay.

As we walked up one of the hosts opened the door for us. That was very pleasant gesture. We were sat immediately and offered drinks. Our server Sara brought us bread took our order and within minutes we were eating. The BBQ Chicken salad was delicious, next time BBQ sauce on the side. The carne asada Pizza never disappoints my better half it tasted great! The chicken pasta for me, not so much. Sara was very attentive and checked on us constantly. We will be back.

I've been coming here since it opened. My service has always been great and I've never had any issues with the food.  Last night came in with the bf for dinner. Our server Aaron was awesome, great customer service and checked up on us a bunch. Our food was really good, they did accommodate  our request. I asked if they served sides separate, they do not.. however the bf did ask for extra potatoes and they were able to make that happen. We also ordered some dessert. The buttercream cake is a bit on the sweet side, but was still good and very filling.  Overall everything was great.

Here's the thing: I just gave a CPK in San Diego a 4/5. I of course take into consideration the experience and service in addition to the food. The reason for the 3/5 for this particular location is that the pepperoni pizza, which is really a flagship of the chain, just honestly wasn't that good.  The experience was a perfect 5/5. The service, again, 5/5. Our server was awesome. Unfortunately I forget his name as it was a few weeks ago. Aaron? Chase? David? I think it was 1-2 syllables. Sorry, I'm a jerk.  Anyway, I think CPK does a bang-up job of hiring and training because it's always an enjoyable social experience. I actually had a CPK gift card that I've been carrying around in my wallet for a number of years and conveniently had an opportunity to use it, so we went a little crazy and ordered some appetizers of pita and hummus and chicken dumplings. The dumplings were great. Probably the best part of the meal, which was a problem because the pizza should have been the showcase here.  It just felt like the thing could have used an extra minute or two of cooking time to solidify all the cheese in the center of the pie. Unfortunately, that is kind of a personal pet peeve of mine when pizzas are runny in the center. I know the restaurant is busy on a Saturday night but this is THE Pizza Kitchen, man! You run the kitchen, it doesn't run you. Anyway, it was a good meal and I had a fun time. I would come back again.

I'm stuffed as I write this review. Came in for lunch. Completely forgot their specials are Monday through Friday (I came in on a Sunday). No big deal, just means I'm getting a full sandwich instead of a half sandwich. I ended up boxing one-half and taking it to-go. It comes with soup as well, and their soup is great. I've tried most of them and I've never been disappointed.  My table also started off with the avocado rolls appetizer. These rolls are thicc and come with ranch and... Thousand island (I think??). Super good apps.  They also offer iced tea and lemonade in baits flavors. I always get the strawberry lemonade. Yum.  Servers are very active, opening the door for you on your way out/in, seating you in a timely manner, and taking orders. They do so accurately and with a smile :). It's all around a pleasant experience.

The usual high quality meal today:  plank salmon, Thai salad, chicken, etc.  Ian, our server, was amazing - so patient, attentive and helpful with our order!  Kudos to CPK in Santa Clarita!  It is because of servers like Ian and the fine quality of your food that we are repeat customers.  Hope Ian sees this.
Gave this place another try. This time take out. Take out portions are smaller. There were maybe 7 tiny pieces of chicken in the $16 dollar garlic chicken Fettuccine. $16!!!! Such a let down.

Struck out twice at this location. Came in on a Sunday. They had a 15 minute wait. We (party 5) waited 45 minutes. The reason for the long wait according to the hostess they didn't have a table available to place a high chair. We noticed several tables were open. We left the location and decided to eat else where.  Came in on Wednesday. The wait was 15 minutes again. Several tables open, however the waiting area was packed. The front counter person said all servers were busy and they could not seat anyone else at the time. Based on our prior experience we just left the location and decided to eat else where.

I went here for lunch on 6/15/15. The place is very clean and modern looking, but other than that I wasn't impressed.  When I entered the place I was greeted with a curt "How Many?!" instead of a "Welcome to CPK", "Hello","Good Afternoon" or even a smile.   The staff are much more interested in talking with each other than paying attention to the customers.  Plus, when my pizza came it was supposed to be a sausage, pepperoni & mushroom.  It had lots of mushrooms, but 3 pepperonis and 2 (yes 2) pieces of sausage.    I've been here three separate times and was treated with the same disdain each time.  Time to go elsewhere.

Worst service ever! Called in an order and they said it would be ready by 9:20, got to curbside at 9:20 called them as instructed to let them know I was there. They said they would be right out as it was ready.  Waited 25 minutes and called them again. They said it was ready it would be right out. Waited 5 more minutes before someone came out, not caring that I had sat there for 30 minutes and was concerned about the freshness and it being cold. He said it had been under warmers for the past 30 minutes! OMFG! So by the time I had got home the cheese was re-coagulated and stiff!  Called 8/26 to speak to a manager about the $35 charge on my credit card for two cheese pizzas and they transferred me to a hostes! Not a flipping manager!  I am so done with this restaurant! The pizza from there tastes just like the crap you get from the freezer aisle of the grocery store!

I placed in an order for delivery to our office today, and was hoping to have a nice Friday catered meal for the team. When we first started the order online, it prompted us with about 19 minutes of a wait time - no big deal. But as people started entering their orders, the time time increased all the way up to a 70 minute wait time - so we hurried up and placed the order!  So, the time for our food delivery comes, and passes, but no food. One of the employees called me and apologizes, saying somehow our order (which we paid extra for delivery) was entered into the system as pick up, and it's been sitting out, waiting for pick up for *over an hour*. She said she's going to remake the food for us and have it delivered, but we'll be waiting even longer now. Why wouldn't they have called us earlier if the food was sitting out for over an hour without a pick up? I get errors happen, but, we're hangry. And now you get this hangry review. I left 2 stars because at least I like the food but this is a little ridiculous.
Last three times I've been here I have the best service the best food and great atmosphere got to remind myself to keep coming back here

Nice place, I usually stop by on once a week with my daughter. She is a great pizza lover, like most of the kids, but my favorite food there is split pea and ham soup. It is the best I have ever tried. I also like their cocktails, my favorite one is Moscow mule. Amaizing! Really recommend. Their service is always great, however there is longer waiting time on weekends.

Terrible terrible terrible management- I called three times to make sure I had a reservation and make sure the table was ready for when I arrived for my sisters surprise 30th birthday dinner. Guess what I arrived 5 min late table was not ready, staff was messing around instead of opening the door for me (other Cpk's do this on a regular basis)when I was carrying balloons and a cake. When I asked is the table ready they said no we are wiping it down. What was the point of calling three times if nothing was done- to top it off the restaurant was not even busy. Let's move on to when I start setting items on the table and the hostess Jillian  was placing the forks on the table and said "what's the problem! The tables ready?"  If your still setting the table up, the floor is filthy and the bench was filthy and your giving me an attitude and the restaurant is not busy- I wonder what the management is like and what type of establishment they are running. I promptly asked for the manager and he greeted me I told him my concern of the the table not being setup and how ride the hostess was- he said ok. 5 minutes passed and he didn't go speak with her or even acknowledge that he was sorry. Long story short we left- not going to support a business that has poor management and rude staff.

It's more of 3.5 than a 3 but the wait time was just too long for almost everything so I leaned towards the 3 than a 4. So, yea what everyone is saying about the wait time is here is sadly true. We go seated right away. We're told our server will be right with us and when she passed by our table she acknowledged us and did say she'll be with us in a few. It prob took more than 5 minutes for our poor waitress to get to our table. I would say the resto was more than 1/2 full but it seems that they're short staff. I took advantage of my free small plate rewards and got a corn guac with chips, it was pretty good. Our main dishes took really long, like more than 15 minutes long. The hub truly enjoyed his chipotle pizza, i had some and it was not bad, it's not your typically greasy pizza so, yea that was good. I got the zucchini shrimp pasta and it wasn't that bad, it could be improved but I guess it's like asking for more calories :) We ordered a citrus cooler with strawberries and it was refreshingly good, I'd order that again.  The waiting game continued again with the check and they forgot to remove our chips and guac but the waitress took care of it after apologizing. Overall, the staff is great, they're just overwhelmed.  We've been to this location a few times the past 2 years so I won't say I wouldn't care for CPK, but I just wish they can improve on this waiting game. It really breaks the dining experience.

Love cpk. Have been to several all over The Valley and LA but this once has terrible service. Our server never offered refills for our drinks, nor asked if we wanted anything else and instead just brought the check when he assumed we were done with our meal. I don't know but waiters should have personality and be more mindful of the dining experience they are creating. Because even if the food is great; if the service isn't then that ruins your meal. It did for me on this day, came to celebrate a birthday and instead of being offered dessert, I was given the check before I was even done with my food.

Slow service, unhappy staff, and a absolutely horrible mobile app.  Do not even try to use their mobile application for anything but tracking points, you will be sorry.  Manager claims he has never used the app and that is probably the case for all the employees since they haven't fixed the issues for a year.  Customer service all around is just poor.

Love, love, love coming here for family gatherings because family style ordering is so easy and cheaper here. I usually leave not LOVING the food, because it's A-ok. Sometimes the portions are too small to make it worth the price, or sometimes they completely miss on the pizza flavors. However, I must admit the most recent time I came on Mother's day, the food tasted exceptionally wonderful. They either stepped up their game...or maybe we are simply learning how to order better dishes. We always start off with the yummy cocktails and avocado egg roll appetizers. The egg rolls are a hit with any age group and although sometimes they overfry it and make it too greasy, it's still almost always really tasty. I mean, avocado and bacon with chicken...what's not to love? We then ordered the sicilian pizza, veggie pizza, garlic cream fettucine, and the pesto creme penne pasta. I didn't try the veggie pizza because I need my meat but everything was so delicious, and the pesto creme penne became my new favorite. We ordered it with shrimp and the shrimp pieces were generous and the pasta was bursting with flavor.  We also got the halibut and although we didn't expect much from a pizza restaurant, it was surprisingly good. However, they could have cooked it a little less to keep it tender. Lucas was a great and attentive server. And thanks to Ruby for being so friendly on the phone!

This is my 3rd time here and it won't be the last. My waiter Kyle was awesome and very attentive to my family and I. Dinner: 3 children Hawaiian pizza, The original barbecue chicken pizza with bacon and the spicy jerk chicken pizza with bacon with a petite wedge with blue cheese dressing .... all so delicious! Desert was sundaes with fudge and sprinkles, a brownie with ice cream and fudge and the oh so buttery butter cake !!!The cake itself deserves a visit alone.

My kids and I stopped by the restraint after my sons first hockey game in Valencia for lunch. You would think it would be easy and quick. Unfortunately communication was a major issue for the server we had.  I ordered something very simple and easy. Of course the lack of caring for what I wanted came into play.  The order came out wrong and I sat there for 10 minutes while my kids enjoyed their lunches. I asked for sugar at the beginning of the meal which 30 minutes in still have not gotten.  Apparently the server didn't give a crap Since he came to the table a few times and didn't have the courtesy to apologize.  The manager thanked me for my feedback which upset me more since I was so upset that I sent the food back.  These bog corporate restaurants/machines don't stain their employees to actually care about getting things right.

Service was kind, but very slow. Had to keep looking for the waiter to get water, or utensils. The food, is overpriced, and for what you get, not worth it. Our bill ended up being $179. I don't know why people keep coming here. My sister ordered a fettuccine Alfredo pasta, and there was barely any sauce on it. It just looks like they dumped noodles on a plate and served that. "There's the pasta, where's the Alfredo?" I had to track the waiter down and ask for some extra sauce. My baby cousin wanted a pizza. The kids pizza is mostly bread. 4 slices of something that looks like you could get in a box at the grocery store for 4 bucks. Yet it, along with the pasta was about $15. We ordered noodles and salads, but it's all just so overpriced and bland, not worth it.

Seriously absolutely the slowest worst service ever. Place was half empty and took 20 minutes to set up table. Waited an hour for food. Had to actually take food to go. Spoke to the manager. He could care less. Offered no apology and made excuses.

I have no problem with the place or the food.  My issue is with the one particular bartender who I've watched furiously scratch his beard, run his hands through his hair, and scratch his nose -- and then make a drink or plate food. This happens every time we see him there.  We've complained to the manager and general manager (she stood next to him once while he scratched for like 30 seconds). Don't know if they've talked to him, but he's still there scratch and rubbing before he makes your drink or plates your food. Bon Appétit! Update: CPK corporate reached out and asked me to submit a ticket via their support site. I did and the store general manager called me directly.  She explained that the employee had been retrained and asked to resign a hygiene policy.  Very responsive company, which is great.  My concern is that the manager told me she couldn't do much more, as she hasn't seen the employee violate the policy.  I understand this, but per my above comments, I watched him scratch for 30 seconds while she stood right next to him. In the end, the response is a bit of a "we've done what we can, sorry", so I'll just choose not to eat at this location anymore.

Don't care for CPK, 2nd time here since it opened. Family called and said they wanted to go, I arrived from the office first. Not busy at all yet they wouldn't seat me until all of my party arrived. After a long day at the office not thrilled. The food is way over priced for what it is, the hostess lil miss I'm too good for this planet was irritating as was the horrible music playing in the background. I'll spend my money elsewhere, where I'm appreciated and made to feel welcome and the food is worth enjoying.

Best curbside service in Santa Clarita. This is the main reason we have been enjoying this place relatively frequently. We have tried curbside elsewhere locally and typically it takes 2-3 times as long. The food is average to good tasting depending on the day.

Came here for dinner. Service was excellent! Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.  They have vegan options!  I used this guide to order: I had the roasted veggie salad - the half size is good enough for one person! I'm so glad that they have vegan options. Definitely a vegan friendly place.

How many ounces of chicken would you think comes on a $15 BBQ chopped chicken salad? After picking food up to go and driving home, we were appalled to find  chicken scraps on the salad...after digging through the pieces of lettuce thinking the chicken could be hidden, we found nothing! So, bringing out my trusted food scale, we gathered the few pieces to find that we were given a whopping 1.8 ounces of BBQ chicken on our $15 salad. Not to mention the avocado we added was less than a quarter of California's glorious creamy avocado. Calling the assistant gm at first was not wanting to refund the card saying we had to go in to refund it. He eventually said he would cancel and refund the whole meal, since we had two orders of pot stickers on there. I get you guys are corporate and have ounces to save. This isn't the first time...but definitely the worst time. I'll take my business else where. Stone fire for the consistent win from here on out.

I am a regular at CPK. I go to this restaurant at least once a week. My rating for CPK is five starts, but this time was  disappointing. It was around 9:15 pm so I ordered online . I picked up the food, when I got home to my surprise they didn't  put any bread or utensils. They usually ask, if you need utensils or not. They didn't even bother to ask me and to my surprise  they didn't put any.   Also, food was cold and I can say it was waste of money. I will not be back to this branch. I rather to go to Simi Valley or Burbank branches.

Recently ate at this place. The food was pretty good, which i can't fault. However, why only 1 star? Within 2 days my debit card was charged $155 2 days later when I wasn't even in the restaurant resulting in the chaos of having to file a dispute with the bank. I am beyond irritated and talking to the manager at this location resulted in someone talking so fast, as if to hurry me off the phone. This is a serious issue. I do not care how busy you are. The only way I would ever visit this location, or any other CPK, is if i'm paying with cash.

Way over priced for what you get now. I ordered online for pick-up, and that went smooth. $34 pizza and Italian salad. Pizza got smaller, crust got bigger, toppings got less. The full size Italian salad was in a container that looked like a half order. When I asked if it was really a full size salad, the waiter said yes, but I can speak to a manager. Why? That's the product they are selling, but I won't be buying. Funny thing is, it was over 100 degrees and we didn't want to cook. I live 2 miles from CPK, and by the time I got home. The pizza was cold. We're done going to CPK.

I received a gift card for CPK and I decided today to try the other dishes on their menu. I placed a pick up order...I ordered The Ribeye Steak and the Pesto Cream Penne pasta. The steak which I specifically put medium rare was WAY over cooked, very disappointed especially since I paid $30 for this tasteless over cooked piece of meat...The pasta was better but that's not saying much because it was lacking salt. I am very disappointed because over cooking a steak is such a rookie move! Come on man. Overall CPK food is over priced and mediocre, the only reason I am giving 2 stars is because the customer service was great! Very friendly staff and my pick up order was right on time.

As far as corporate chain restaurants go KPC is unusually good.  This particular location is a good one for a business lunch.  The wait staff is prompt and efficient with respect to getting you in and out within an hour.  Word to the wise no reservations for groups but you can do one hour call ahead seating.  Our waiter was Ian and he was very proactive with getting us in and out on time and he was very knowledgeable of the menu and addressing vegetarian concerns.  If you have never been to KPC before you really should give them a chance.  Their niche is traditional recipes Italian and general Meridian with a little Asian all prepared with unusual ingredients.  The recipes have clearly been well thought out because the fusion of flavors works well.  The are quite willing to make changes to the defaults and prepare them they way you want.  Everything is made to order and the ingredients are all fresh and premium quality.  The negative reviews I see here seem mainly related to timeliness of service.  I did not experience that on a noon business day lunch when the place was about 75% full , but, there are not very many decent restaurants in this area either, I suspect they are very busy in the evenings.  use the call ahead seating places that do not take reservations are generally very busy.

This was my first time at CA Pizza Kitchen and it was amazing the CA club pizza was great. I typically don't like tomatoes, but these were perfect on this little pizza! Our waiter Ian was awesome too! He was super nice and checked in with us frequently, he sampled an avocado dip to after taking our order and it complimented the rest of the meal perfectly. I highly recommend this place. Oh and the Avocado Egg Roll is amazing! Great place to conclude a great weekend.
I really liked this location! Ian was my server and he was great. Very friendly and helpful. Funny too. Restaurants need more people like him, makes for a great experience.
What a wonderful experience at California pizza kitchen. Ian was our server and killed it. We ordered everything he suggested. Could not off been happier. Will be back to see Ian. Ask for Ian!!!
Service was poor. Server didn't know the menu content and was slow to respond to our needs, lime no silver waste our napkins.  Food was marginal

Just left this CPK and felt it was necessary to leave a review because the service was THAT good. Our server was named Kyle and he was honestly amazing. He was very kind and accommodating to everything we asked. Brought out extra bread, was SUPER diligent with refills, and even brought out multiple boxes to see which one we would like for our left overs. The restaurant wasn't busy, but he not only treated my boyfriend and I well, but EVERY ONE of his tables! Seriously he rocks and I hope to get him next time I visit this location!

My dad and I had a very disappointing experience last night. The service was AWFUL, I can't believe that such a large chain can get away with having such terrible service. We complained to the waiter about the extended waiting time (45 minutes!) for our food, he not apologetic at all and brushed us off. We asked for the check soon after that and it took him another 15 minutes to bring it out. I am giving two stars as the food was delicious, but I'll definitely only get takeout from now on!

This place is right down the street from my subdivision. It's an excellent place to eat, both inside the restaurant and for ordering takeout. The pizza, pasta and desserts taste delicious and all the employees, from the people that open the door for you, to the waiters or waitresses that service you, to the person that gives you your takeout order, are all really nice and polite. This is by far one of the easiest five star reviews I've typed out because they are that consistent with their service.  Strongly recommend this place for anyone who wants to go out for Pizza!
I just ordered a salad to go...$20! Really? Mayb 4 oz of chicken charged $3 for 1/2 an avocado Ridiculous

Everything was absolutely delicious! Despite being a very busy Saturday night, we had attentive, patient, and very helpful service from Shelby.  All of our food, from our small plate macaroni to the soufflé for dessert, was perfectly seasoned and cooked to deliciously hot serving temperature. We will definitely make a point of coming here again.

Came here on my lunch break and received fast service which was good. After picking apart my order I was left half satisfied. I ordered crispy Mac n cheese thinking it was the pasta dish instead I got these dry nugget looking overcooked bites, not good! And they say they have "Fresh" lemonade so I got the mango and it was filled with alot of syrup! Can syrup be fresh?! At least the Hawaiian pizza was good. Not very big but good.

I normally do not like CPK. it's just not my thing. Tonight I went with a large group and everything went smoothly. Alyssa our server,  or one of,  was great. Embryos had a great time. Oh yeah,  the food was great too. I had Mahi Mahi tacos

I've given this place so many chances. Too many chances actually! Nothing ever changes and I'm the dummy that keeps coming back. But today was the last time. I'm so over giving this place a chance. I grew up in the valley and the CPK on topanga has always been amazing. This one, is awful. The food, the service, the manager. Everything. As a previous restaurant manager, CPK NEEDS to replace the restaurant manager at this location. He's rude, fails to see the problems in the restaurant, blames the customer and overall just doesn't have good restaurant manager implementation skills or attitude. Today, my BBQ chicken salad actually had avocado on it (which is a miracle in and of itself as they usually always forget it) but the salad tastes of one thing and one thing only, a chlorine chemical type taste. It's inedible. A $52 meal for two salads, and a kid Mac and cheese with fruit and both salads are inedible. Absolutely no excuse for this. Like I said previously, this is one incident today but we've had probably 12 bad experiences minimum here. Good thing Cheesecake opened today!!! Bye bye CPK, I'll get my salads elsewhere from now on.

Dirty tables Dirty floors Going downhill fast.  I ordered the Mahi Mahi fish tacos.  A lot of cabbage, very little fish. My wife ordered the BBQ chopped chicken salad. It had lettuce and chicken but not much else.  Likely my last time here for a while.

Service was terrible again. Thought the first time it was a fluke but it happened again. Felt bad for our waitress as they were understaffed and not prepared for customers on a  Saturday night.  If you have to have their food your better off just getting it to go. Over a 2 hour wait for a salad and a pizza...... Unacceptable!!!

This my first experience eating at California Pizza Kitchen. I was extremely satisfied with our amazing server, Andrew! He was so attentive and recommended tasty dishes to our group. He's probably one of the best servers I've ever had! The manager even came out and welcomed us, as it is our first time eating at the franchise. The kitchen also sent us a celebratory dessert since I was having dinner the day before my graduation. I would definitely come back here again!  Thank you for the great service Andrew!!

We had a group of 8 for Mother's Day lunch so we figured we'd go someplace large and dependable. My Sweet Wife loves to eat outside but it's raging hot so I call and confirm that they have misters on the patio. Looks like we're good, so off to CPK we go.  We arrive and discover that the misters aren't working and that they've recently remodeled the patio and somehow forgotten to install any shade. They've got these fashionable little triangles of fabric that don't offer that much cover and somehow they've overlooked installing even these meager measures in the center of the space.  We change plans and head inside. The service was wonderful but I unfortunately ordered the Korean BBQ pizza. It wasn't that great and my wife says it reminds here of the taste in the back of her throat after she's gotten airsick.  I love you CPK. We have a long history.... but on Mother's Day you tried to give my wife heat stroke and then reminded her of barf. Happy Mother's Day! 2013 #86 / 365
Always consistent.  Pick up was very quick and easy.   If you dine in, order a hot fudge sundae, it's not on the menu, but it's decadent.

I just moved to the area, and CPK is great! Their food is so yummy and they have perfect sharable items. I came in last week with my sister, and I just wanted to thank kris the busser. He was so attentive, made sure my experience was great,  and he did a great job!  I will definitely be coming back! :)

Well, we have not visited in a bit and most of the staff and manager we have come to know are no longer there.  Unfortunately, their replacements are less then service minded.  It really felt like I was in a frat house...the "all Dude" staff and manager were more involved with each other than the customers there were supposed to be taking care of.  Has to ask for another drink and we were sitting right in front of the bartender!  They also ran out of bread and were all surprised by this, you would have thought someone might have mentioned this as they took out the last loaf...but then again, the staff was more concerned with laughing at each other's jokes.  The cooks in the back were working hard and the food was still good, just now seems you will have to work harder to get it served to you. However we did find pieces of bacon on our artichoke & spinach pizza.  Will give it another try in a few weeks and hope the team at Phi Kappa Sigma get it together.

California Pizza Kitchen - Reboot! Kind of excited...the restaurant I grew up with, California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) has had a remodel...well...not exactly just a remodel. Met by Susan Halstead, the General Manager of our local Valencia CPK, the first thing she told me was that people that now walk in the door don't recognize that they're in a CPK if they haven't been to the Valencia location in the last two months. Susan turned me over to Cole Brocato, bartender and trainer, who has been here at our local CPK for 9 years. Cole said that they were focusing more on California inspired fare and less on pizza alone. Fresh ingredients, like California fruits and vegetables, are now more emphasized. Full Cocktail Program In providing "unique spirited cocktails" we had to try the Blueberry Ginger Smash - refreshing, tangy, reminded me of a whiskey Buck plus fruit - and the California Roots  avocado colors the drink, while mint and agave sour takes center stage in this unique cocktail.  The California Crush reminded Cole of traditional Valencia flavors, and we enjoyed the citrus and mint flavors that made me think of a white wine Sangria - only better. Our teen had the Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler - a nice virgin drink that was both sweet and light. These cocktails are new at CPK Valencia and are only available in the remodeled stores. Cole said that eventually all of the restaurants will be re-done. And you can get all the classic cocktails, just like the BBQ chicken pizza, too. The cocktail recipes, Cole said, are unique to CPK. Yes, they can make a Lemon Drop but they can also make a cocktail with Domaine de Canton Ginger liqueur or St. Germain Elderflower. Cole said, "Local citrus in cocktails, California wines; we make it fresh, trendy, and organic when we can." Taste the Unique With the new rollout, and as they have locations all over U.S., they "want visitors to be wowed on what California Pizza Kitchen is about." Don't be concerned that the pizzas are now listed on a long "side bar" of the menu, your favorites, like BBQ Chicken, Thai Chicken, Hawaiian, etc., are still there. But you will also find, under "seasonally inspired" menu items, a Maine Lobster Flatbread (cool lobster, loved the dill, great with the California Roots cocktail) Roasted Garlic Chicken (super mist and flavorful) with Seasonal Vegetables, Ribeye (Another moist and "never frozen" with great marbling to give great flavor, liked the peppery spice and butter topped on this one, and Pinot Noir salt), California Fields Salad and Tricolore Salad Pizza. Under "main plates" - this is the "middle section and where it's really at" Cole said - the "Halibut is never farmed, always line caught, cooked on a cedar plank and that keeps it moist." And it WAS! Delicious, great medley of spices, definitely would order again. And though we were stuffed, Ed couldn't resist having one more bite before we wrapped up our leftovers. Lunch Duos on the menu are geared to foodies that want quality and watch how much they are eating. Small Cravers fit that bill too, and have more a gastro pub like items. All the cheese, goat and cow, is pasteurized, Cole added. Originally guests had several menus, now it's all in one plus a beverage menu, which is more standard. "You're a pizza place, why do you have this steak on the menu?" Cole says people sometimes ask and he tells them to go ahead, "have the steak", and then they get it. Final Touches We sampled the seasonal-only-always-sells-out Strawberry Shortcake made with sweet biscuit, with a surprise touch of candied lemon zest glaze sprinkled over homemade whipped cream. The decadently rich Butter Cake is made with a sliver of cheesecake, warm and covered in ice cream and whipped cream; something Cole says people skip appetizers to save room for. The S'mores dessert is served with a jumbo graham, dark chocolate chunks, milk chocolate pudding and torched marshmallows - a sticky gooey all-consuming delightful mess. Some of the restaurants build the bar around the kitchen as a showcase. We did enjoy sitting at the bar, it was definitely the center of the action. All menus have different pizzas pictured on the cover, and according to Cole, the servers try to hand guests at the same table different ones - nice touch! Cole added that they hire their staff based on them being the right person and not on having to have the two years of service experience. Our teen thought that was great. Finally, when we glanced around the room completely sated and packed up leftovers we noticed both managers serving guests, people looking happy, and maybe some room for more. Facebook album:

Take-out: Third time in a row that Take-out has given us the wrong order. We were told pick up time was 20 minutes but didn't get our food for 35 min then given the wrong order. Had to remake our pizza and took a total of 1 hour.
Awesome welcome, server Mike was amazing. I really enjoyed my kungpao spaghetti . Must visit ... Amazing choices ... A blend of multi cuisine into pizza and pastas.

Let me start off by saying that I love CPK! I frequently dine in and order take out. We had an incident 11 days ago and I didn't want to make a big deal about it. We ordered a bunch of food, got home, had family waiting to eat and discovered our margherrita was burnt to a crisp! We ate our lunch and brought back the pizza to show your staff how disgusting and inedible that pizza was! The manager who helped me sent me home with a $15 gift card. Okay, that was nice I supposed. Didn't exactly satisfy our craving for pizza but at least we didn't throw money in the garbage. Now, last night we decided to order take out again. We ordered the margherrita again and a jerk chicken pizza. Although our incident from 11 days ago was fresh in our minds we decided to give you the benefit of the doubt and wrote it off as a "bad day" for your take out service. Sadly, we were wrong! We were optimistic when we opened the margherrita and discovered it looked  perfect! However, the jerk chicken pizza was terrible! Same story! It was charred!! How is this okay?? I am so disappointed in these last two visits.
Clean, organized and staff is awesome.  That alone is worth every penny.. Food is pretty good too ;). Love!

I actually was surprised.  I hadn't been to a CPK for many years, as I previously just wasn't particularly motivated to do so, but now that has changed. I ordered a Blue Moon, it was delivered cold, nice and tall.  Price was a decent price for a restaurant.  My wife ordered a Harvest Sangria, it had basil in it, elderflower juice, a bit of rum, and some white wine, and a couple grapes. Served in a St Germaine glass that I now have to hunt down.  It was very nice. My wife had the Chicken Milanese.  She felt the chicken wasn't that great and was a bit greasy.  I tried it.  I felt that while it was a tad greasy and could have used some crunch, it was good and the sauce on top (tomatoes etc.) was VERY good. I had the mushroom pizza.  Both my wife and I agreed that it was actually one of the better tasting pizza's we had ever had. We had the butter cake.  While my wife and I have a "favorite" in California, this one was actually very good and worth coming there to get it alone.  Order it with ice cream. The server was personable, attentive, professional, and friendly. My wife had another harvest Sangria, because she really enjoyed the first one quite a bit.  She rarely ever gets a second drink, so that's a good drink. The ambiance is nice, it's corporate, but it's nice, clean, friendly looking place. The menu is fairly extensive.

I had hoped for a delicious meal but the small amount of chicken spoiled it for me. I ordered the Chicken Tequila Pasta. Tons of pasta with very little chicken. It would have been nice to start coming here in the future , but I won't.

came here for mother's day two nights ago with my entire family. it was awesome. the food was great and didn't take too long. 1. avocado egg rolls definitely recommend. it is soooooo good. 2. veggie pizza and cicilian pizza was whatevers for me which is a big deal because i actually really like pizza. my two toddlers loove pizza and they weren't into it much either. 3. garlic parmesan fettucine was so good. the right amount of creamy and garlic flavor. 4. the shrimp pesto penne with the sunddried tomatoes was pretty decent too. my 2yr old daughter looved it. the shrimp with the pesto was delicious.

Blake informed, my son, at take out, there was no bread in the entire store. There was no other option relayed... Then I called and Jacob, the manager told us, there was some type of miscommunication and they have bread a plenty. Our guests - I'm not sure what to say to them, but it's not going to make us look good. California Pizza Kitchen needs to fix this asap. The facts are that we have butter, olive oil, but no bread. After my call I'm left with being less than satisfied, "We will give you something special the next time you come into the store person..."  We have had issues with this CPK before and the manager, at that time, had someone on the staff deliver the missing items. Unfortunately, there is no way to make it 100% - especially when CPK fumbles the ball yet again!!!

Painfully slow service. Trying to entertain a hungry two year old in a restaurant when all she wants to do is feed the ducks is hard enough. It's even worse when you have to ration water while waiting an eternity for cold pizza that had obviously been sitting on the ready counter for quite some time. Very disappointing. We will not be back

I have been here many times and to be honest this location has disappointment me several times. I go out to the one in Ventura and never have an issue or the location in Burbank and never have an issue. Just this one. It's always a different server so I'm leaning toward the cook maybe not paying attention or not liking my request...... I don't like dried parsley on top of my pizza. It's just a little thing but my kid and I won't eat the pizza if it's on there so we order it that way and send it back. So far at least 3 out of 4 times possible 4 out 5. It's frustrating when it's the same issue every time. They never discount the food. The never take the pizza off the bill. I always eat after everyone else and the manager and server do nothing to apologize for their error. They always admit they messed up but that's the end of it. Hope you have a better experience!

Zach was our waiter tonight & even though he was new he was amazing. Constantly checking on us, seeing if we needed refills, and just going above and beyond to make the experience great. Thank you Zach, for the great service... we will be back!!
I really like CPK, it has great food good service and my 6 year old loves pizza so it's a win fir everybody. Very clean restaurant and no problems with any of the staff there

I feel like this place has gone to trash within the last year or two. The servers are nice, but they're strange and always seem to hold the most random conversations about their family or your super cute key chain while your mid-stuffing your mouth with food.  Everything has jumped in price, and it doesn't guarantee better quality as the recent menu change removed all the customer favorites. Like NO, I don't want a pizza drenched in olive oil with hard crust, topped with goat cheese and almonds while you call it a name that doesn't have any correlations to the ingredients.  What even is California Pizza Kitchen anymore. Bring back the California Pizza Kitchen from 2008 when everything was fantastic and you weren't paying $65+ for two people.
Awesome service today, just as we arrived the place was slammed, so the manager assisted us and basically served us. Her customer service was outstanding! This location never disappoints.

We went in for a quick dinner with the littles and didn't know we'd end up leaving feeling the way we did. Those kinds of experiences don't happen often, let me tell you. They exceeded our expectations and then some! Our server Lori was such a sweetheart and made us feel like our order choice was genius and was attentive and caring about my family! The manager Efrain came by and we chatted with him a bit. He told us a funny story and had us laughing! After savoring our simple yet delicious Hawaiian pizza and Octoberfest (awesome draft choice!), we indulged and shared the key lime pie...oh man, so good. The young man (host) who held the door as we left and was very delightful too. We will be back soon!

I have given this location a dozen times. Last 3 visits have been a nightmare! Bad service or a bartender being my waiter. This place is always understaffed with dirty dishes & flatware. I am Warning you that the wait service is long w a sweaty runner doing all the working pushing plates. The 2 male mangers are robots w responses. Do something about your place! Love the frozen taste & bagged salad oozing w tons of dressing soaking it like its drowning in lack of taste. Can't wait for Cheesecake Factory at the mall this Summer. CPK who in June?

CPK needs CPR Servers bus their own tables, the host also doubles as a food runner, kitchen is short staffed.  Sad state of affairs in the CPK.  The straw that broke the rating floor from a  3 to a 2 star rating was the turtle slow service on a light weeknight.  I ordered an avocado club roll which came out quickly then it all went downhill from there.  A split pea soup, a couple kid's pizzas and spaghetti took 30 minutes to arrive. I got two iced tea refills but had to ask 6 times - not a good ratio at all.  On the brighter side, food quality was good - right temperature, right flavors.  Restaurant is clean and well maintained. At least there's free WiFi to pass the time waiting for service.  Next time I'll just buy your pizza from the frozen food section and bake it myself.

I've been here many times but not within the last few months and I think the cleanliness has gone way down hill. My silverware was covered in stuck on food from what appeared to be the last eater's salad... SO gross. The other people I was dining with had severely water stained/dirty silverware as well. Plates were dirty and crusted with food on the bottoms... Double gross. Such a shame because this used to be an office favorite. PS service, specifically the time it takes for your food to come out has always been extra long at this location.

Today might have just been a bad day for them but ordered an order for take out. Arrived approx 10 mins after pickup time, yet still had to wait approx 30 MINUTES for the food. No reasonable explanation was given unless you call "we were waiting on the wedge salad" reasonable? Then on top of it they couldn't even get the drink order correct? Luckily it wasn't slammed busy at all yet a wedge salad held up the family dinner. Ain't gonna happen. The Mgr offered to "cover the order" well way too late. He was very apologetic and polite but his staff/kitchen failed today. I gave him back the food and walked over to the sushi place and will spend more money there.

I hadn't been at cpk in a long time and actually this was my first time at this location. We came for lunch and it was very busy.Kristin was great. She was very helpful and was constantly refilling our drinks. We ordered the avocado egg rolls as appetizer and were satisfied with it. We order a pepperoni pizza and creamy garlic fettuccine. The food is pricey for the portion and quality of the food. However, the service was great . Although it was pretty busy, Kristin was constantly asking us if we needed anything.

Of the 5 or 6 times I have been to this location, my experiences have ranged from below average to outstanding.  This last time in particular (Sunday, 09/07/14) was exceptional.  We had a large party of 14, and were seated promptly.  They were able to accommodate us on short notice and did not do the whole "wait until your entire party arrives to seat you" thing that some restaurants do.   Our server, Kristin, was outstanding at her job.  She was friendly, professional, and extremely patient with our entire party.  I can't imagine dealing with a large party (especially one with kids) is easy, but she certainly made it seem that way.  She was smiling every time we saw her, and she did not get a single thing wrong with our order.  She also kept the refills flowing without us having to flag her down...  She honestly did a better job solo, than other restaurants have done with multiple servers.  Excellent hire CPK. As for the food, I am not the biggest fan of their pizza, but it does the trick.  I tried out their crispy thin crust option for the first time, and was glad I did.  I found it to be much better than their regular styled pizzas, and will likely repeat the order the next time I come in.  Someone in our party brought an outside cake for everyone to share, so I was not able to confirm that their red velvet cake is still heavenly.  Assuming it is still the same brand/recipe as years past, then trust me when I tell you it is a must try.  Best red velvet cake I have tried on the west coast. Overall, while Kristin and their red velvet cake are 5 stars, the pizza is just not good enough for me to crave.  Given a choice, there are more than a few other local spots I would prefer for pizza.  Their pizza is not bad, but it isn't the best out there.  This is more due to personal taste as opposed to anything they are doing wrong, so I would still recommend you give them a shot if you haven't already.

A year and a half ago this place was 5 stars vs the ones we used to frequent. They were fast attentive and the manager was great.  After the manager left it just slowed to a halt.  The new manager works really hard don't get me wrong but he doesn't work smart. He's all over the place doing everybody's jobs but the problem is he should show them how to do it. The staff that was on point has all been replaced with lazy inept people who just figure that they will get the tip anyway. Our last ten visits have left us more and more disappointed. It's sad when you see a place like this decline so strongly. We used to come every week religiously and now it's maybe every other. They are extremely inconsistent. Sometimes if I order a full salad I get a half. They tell me it's a full but seriously we come all the time. It's annoying when you know you're being cheated. I enjoy their food and if I order a pizza it's usually dead on. Unfortunately I also like their salads.  The bread thing mentioned by others is accurate. We now usually get the bread around the end of the meal because apparently they have to wait for the yeast to rise. It's always "in the oven and will be right out"    Seriously it's bread. They need to train the staff because they just stand around in the kitchen or at the empty bread section. God forbid you want a refill. And even when you mention it they just have the oh well attitude. I've been eating at Cpk in general for over a decade and it's hard to stay loyal here. I may just move to wolf creek where the manager moved to because he was awesome and so was the service under his watch.  This manager is too nice he would rather do the work of twenty instead of delegating it to the staff. The staff is changing too frequently so they don't seem to get the hang of it and god is it SLOW!!! I shouldn't be there for over an hour unless I choose to be!!

Come in today for an early lunch with my sister.  We were seated right away, the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Our server was there right away, took our drinks order but we needed a minute to decide what we wanted. Took him about 15 -20 mins to come back for our orders. Then we had to wait another 30mins for our food. We ordered the white corn chips small plate and there was literally less than 10 decent size piece of chips the rest was crumbs. Rest of the food was good, but be prepared to wait a long time.

Seriously the best service and quality CPK food. KAte and the manager were great. Food was out quickly, extra bread and refills on kids drinks were prompt! I was very impressed !! Best CPK I've been to in a very long time !!

Went mid morning, I ordered a mimosa (they brought me a whole little bottle of champagne with it) and we also ordered 2 pizzas.  The pizzas are relatively small but so delicious: I got the California Club I believe, and it had a bunch of fresh veggies on top.  The wait staff was very accommodating and the overall atmosphere was pleasant - not too loud or crazy.

Despite my boyfriend and I coming in 30 minutes before closing, we were still greeted warmly and sat by the hostess. Our waiter Blake was very kind and gave us the perfect amount of attention and space for our date. I always appreciate that with waiters. The food at most CPKs is usually great and this location was not an exception. My boyfriend also ordered the blueberry ginger smash, which turned out to be delicious. This location is fairly small but very pretty, especially with the bridge outside and the lights around the deck at nighttime.

I'm a CPK fan and it's hard to give them less then 5-stars.  They would have to do something really bad for me to rate them poorly.  My favorite spots are Mike's restaurant in Encino and Joe's spot in Simi Valley (in the mall) but this spot came in pretty dang close to them. Promised my nieces and nephews that we'd go to Islands for dinner.  I was flying solo and chasing after these kids was like herding cats.  My nephew is 4 so he peed himself and we had to make a detour from Islands and head home so his mom can clean up the mess cause I don't roll like that.  So the girls made the kids eat at home and that blew my plans and made the kids cry.  Me, being their favorite uncle, promised that we'd at least go out for dessert so we came to CPK.   Here's where I'm going with this: I was tired and I knew that I'd pay at least $40 for ice cream so now I'm under duress with these kids.  I made the order and my server saved my ass.  She came back to the table with a kids menu that had the same exact thing they wanted for $2!  We changed the order, my tab was $9 and I tipped her $10 for being a super cool server. I wish I remembered her name so I can mention her here but I'll get it next time!  You are a super cool chick and I'm gonna bring my little monsters back!

The restaurant is now under new management since my post back in 2011.  This is a very good thing.  We ended up trying CPK again, due to my kids having a fundraising effort through their school here.   The service was 100% improved since 3 1/2 years earlier.   Bread was brought out automatically, the food was good, the service was excellent - and most noticeable, the manager of the restaurant stopped by our table before left and asked how everything was.   Amazing the difference management can make! In any case, it was all thumbs up, and we'll be returning.   Kudos to the new management for turning this establishment around!
Sat at the bar that was never bussed throughout my meal. Ordered wine that was delivered, not poured. Received meal placed on the bar near bartender not me no silverware. Rough note at CPK.

My fiancé and I got a gift card from a friend so we decided to order take-out tonight. We hadn't been here before but I figured that such a large chain would be great.  We didn't realize that the pizza is ridiculously small, more like an individual size pizza. We ordered a chicken BBQ pizza and a side of humus. Although the flavor of the pizza was good, there was very little chicken on it. The hummus was an insult to all humus around the world. Even store bought humus was offended by their watery humus!!!  An 11" pizza and a side of humus, $22!!   On a positive note, we didn't get food poisoning.

Came here for lunch. I discovered a dead fly in my salad. Managers comes to the table and says "oh it's just a fruit fly". I said no it's not a fruit fly! It's a big dead fly. I was so grossed out. As a thank you he comped only 1 of the meal. Like really. It's not a matter of money, but have some decency. Probably one of the worst managers, incompetent at best.

My office orders from here often, typically large orders and almost always togo. They make it so easy on us, we just always go back! The two servers who have helped us recently multiple times are Kate and Michelle and they are both really helpful, organized, and sweet. The orders are correct, the food is yummy, there is ample parking and even curbside pick up. This CPK rocks!

My husband loves this place,  though I prefer a different menu fare,  I have never been disappointed with any thing I've ordered.  The service Is impeccable. Whoever trains their staff, should be hired to train some of the neighborhood establishments.  Can't say anything bad about CPK.

I've been going to California pizza kitchen for years, and have always loved it! But something that they've started doing recently has me puzzled. The garlic chicken pizza is what my husband and I have always ordered for years and years. Just recently they started taking it off the menu and saying that it was only going to be available at certain times of the year! ??  What? Chicken & garlic are only available during the summer? It's foolish! if it's everybody's favorite why in the world would you take it off of your menu!? My husband doesn't even want to go anymore... Or maybe just go back when it's available? :/
Great food and service! Most CPK's are consistently good, but this was a perfect visit. Greg was very attentive and positive. Food was prepared to perfection and drinks were delicious!!

Love tis place. Favorite dish is the Arugula Quinoa salad, I order with grilled Salmon. It has everything I love in it, from FRESH avocado, sun dried tomatoes, pine nuts and red onion. Pre-tossed with a tasty vinaigrette dressing. Every bite has some of everything and I get sad when I see it's almost finished. I could easily order a 2nd, because I never want it to end, but I know I'd be full once it arrived. CON #1 at this particular CPK, seems to be filled with a LOT of young children, with parents who neglect to notice when their high pitched screams, running around, kicking the booth seats, jumping etc. We have had to ask to relocate to a less rambunctious area of the restaurant. And now when we arrive, the 1st thing we say after how many in our party is..."PLEASE seat us where there are no screaming children", then we pray the next hostess does not seat that same issue in our area. CON #2 is the price of their wine. We really enjoy our wine, but we've come to realize drinking water is our better option at CPK. The price for a decent size glass of wine is upwards of $14+. We can go to Salt Creek and get an entire bottle of higher end wine on Monday night for $20, and on Wednesdays, 1/2 off per glass of wine...without all the rug rats screaming in the room. My suggestion, is since this CPK seems to cater to deaf parents who have no respect with rambunctious children, that you have an area designated for these families.

This is our favorite restaurant bar none to celebrate an occasion or just treat ourselves. There is one server there who is FAST, efficient and friendly - she has long hair and is pretty slender - didn't catch her name or I would include it in this review - but we have NEVER had to wait for a table, the setting is beautiful with the water feature and ducks outside - you can buy duck food for a quarter  - and the parking lot has ample spaces. The food is SOOO good  - especially their salted caramel pudding! Have to admit we have a bias as this was where we had our first date - albeit in a Northern California location - but nonetheless, CPK delivers great service, reasonable prices and fantastic food. BTW - the manager of this place has been observed going around to tables and provides additional napkins or whatever you are looking for.

We (wife and two boys) come to this CPK often.  However, this last time the service was poor and the food was just okay. We needed to ask for napkins, utensils, refills and take our appetizer plate away.  I ordered a house salad and the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. The Chicken Tequila Fettuccine came before the salad. Not even half way done and we are being asked if we would like dessert, we say no and our bill is given to us. I don't know if our  waiter was new,  but we've had much better service in the past.

My girlfriend got a gift card to CPK so she decided to treat me for her first time there. I've been to CPK before but never got the service that I received at this location. I was absolutely amazed at how great the service was! Our server brought out the manager to great us for my gf's first time and he brought us a complimentary appetizer.  Great service!  Great food!  Great location!!

Driving on a road trip and stopped here. Hadn't been in 6+ years so they gave us a free flat bread appetizer! That was wonderful. The lunch meal is really good. A personal pizza and bug side salad for $10.95... Good deal! Plus bread. The employees were great. Friendly and on top of it.

Food was great, restaurant was very clean. Would have 5 stars but we asked for bread 3 times and never got it. Spencer needs to be retrained. First time we asked said sure, never brought it out. Second time we asked he said it was baking and would be 5 minutes, never came again. Third time he said again it would be 5 minutes, we gave up after that. So we ate our pasta with no bread.

We finally tried this place and was greeted by the manager who not only hurried,but nearly flew to the door to welcome us along with a server. We were quickly seated and menus brought equally quick. We order our drinks and mine was a berry fruit and lemon aid drink which was so good. We order our pizza and it was fantabulously good. it was Hawaiian BBQ . We really enjoyed this place and the atmosphere cannot be beat.
I love CPK!! Always great food and great service! My boyfriend and I will always be faithful customers. The employees are the nicest people.

Started off with the Mac n' Cheese and came out like chicken nuggets which I wasn't expecting that but it's a cool twist to a classic dish.  I'm not a big fan of fried food so I would say it's unfair to rate it poorly, but I personally would not order it again. I come here every once in a while and always order the same thing. The Kung Pao Spaghetti with added shrimp is TO DIE FOR!  I love love love this dish and will always order this until I grow old and wrinkly. The Spinach Artichoke is pretty good but try and substitute the chips for pita bread, it's amazeballs.  Our server was great and very prompt with delivering our food. He kept up with my brothers endless amount of refills which was impressive.

I really enjoyed going to this place, the food is always fresh, tastes great, and service never lacks. I love their chicken Caesar salad, their veggie whole wheat pizza, and my old favorite chicken tequila fettuccine. They also have nice selection of wine. If you're looking for simple and delicious, CPK is perfect for just that. Also, lots of parking area and it's free. :)

My wife and I come here to this CPK in a regular basis and we really enjoy the friendly service! They are very nice, quick to keep our drinks full and always taking good care of us. We really like one server especially. His name is Blake and he is awesome. Now for the food! I love the thin crust pizza and my wife, Mary Gregory loves all the variety. She's had just about everything and hasn't had a dish she didn't care for. She loves the BBQ Chicken pizza and would recommend that to anyone.  BTW, if you like fondue contact Mary Gregory or visit her website at  .

Kyle Is The Best Server At This Place. He Goes Above & Beyond With Each Customer. Foods Always Delicious & Place Is Always Packed. Since They Updated There New Menu There's Lots More Choices To Choice From. We Highly Recommend Checking This Place Out. Ask For Kyle, You Won't Be Disappointed.

Extremely RUDE Clientele! Called to see what the estimated wait time would be for a party of three and was told that they are not allowed to give wait times over the phone! We have eaten here several times, and even though our orders have not been quite accurate, we've always come back because the food has always been good. They definitely don't need the business so we will dine elsewhere
Food  a little cold, they tried to add the "complementary"'appetizer for being a first timer to my bill. Not impressed. Go to Lazy Dog for way better food and beer selection.

(Dined 05/29/13 W @ 1:00pm): Pizza should be considered its own food group! The month of May's installment of "Brand Specialists flee the coop for lunch get away" found us at the California Pizza Kitchen located in the Bridgeport Marketplace. This location was far enough from our work campus so we didn't have to worry about running into other colleagues. After all, this was our time to get caught up with each other, aired any grievances about work, and generally sat back and let loose in the comfort and solace amongst ourselves. As you know, I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants for various reasons, but that's about all you'd find in "Awesometown". Our party of seven requested to sit in the outdoor patio and took advantage of the nice warm and breezy weather. Once we arranged a couple tables and settled in with menus in-hand, this was how the lunch break broke out...for me, anyway:   Caribbean Sunset Sangria ($8.00) - The mango puree caught my attention (as would anything with this fruit from the Gods) and I loved my frou-frou drinks. The drink arrived in a glorious vibrant orange color with blueberries and various wedges of fruit throughout, white wine, and apple juice that filled-out the goblet this was served in. As tasty as it was, it was short on the wine and alcohol as good sangria should leave one with a sugary fuzzy buzz, which this sadly didn't.      Habanero Carnitas Original Crust Pizza ($13.00) - To this day I've yet ordered any entrée other than pizza (heck, it's in it's name!; I've boycotted the beef dishes at El Pollo Loco on principle alone!). This small-sized pie consisted of slow-roasted pulled pork and housemade cilantro pesto with a side of "seriously spicy habanero salsa". I enjoyed everything about the pizza except the fact that the habanero was served on the side. I truly expected it to be marinated with the pork and not as an afterthought or condiment. Again, if it's in the name I expected it cooked with it. I wouldn't expect a separate dish of orange sauce at a Chinese restaurant if I ordered orange chicken! And the "seriously spicy..." was a complete exaggeration of the habanero sauce as it was more like a purring kitten...very tame.  Bread with Olive Oil Dipping Sauce (complimentary) - What can be said other than it's free, you could ask for more if you wanted, and I simply loved bread. That's it! Service - Overall, I was disappointed with the service, and I hoped they just happened to be short-staffed. Half of our party arrived and we requested to be seated out on the patio. I noticed only a table of two was being used yet we still had to wait, even after our entire party arrived. Then, granted we weren't immediately ready to place our respective orders and needed more time, our waitress took 15 minutes (yes, I timed it because I used to work in the service sector) which was unacceptable. We got our drink and food orders relatively quick, as well as the check once we were done, but they were slow on filling our water glasses and refillable drinks during our meal. Parking - This was a breeze since they shared an open lot that had a ton of spaces with other businesses in this marketplace.  Overall, California Pizza Kitchen was generic and very formulaic. With so many better gourmet pizza options out there these days, I felt CPK's been left in the dust. They did own this niche back in the 90's but didn't seemed to evolve. I found minimal value based on the prices, service, and experience noted above (my total bill was around $21.00 before tip), but when the few positives was the complimentary bread, that's a major issue. The atmosphere, décor, and ambience was modern inside with many booths and tables/chairs that filled the dining area. There was also a eating bar area that looked into the kitchen and pizza ovens. The outside patio was like someone's backyard with uncomfortable chairs and heating lamps for those cooler days or evenings. Since it was right at the corner of a busy intersection, the car traffic noise at times made it difficult to converse, but the sun and breeze felt nice. And, there were several TVs both indoor and outdoor, great for big sporting events. The attire was totally casual so normally I'd be in a t-shirt, boardshorts, and flip-flops. And they accepted my credit card of choice...AMEX!

I've been to many California pizza chicken locations, but this location was definitely different. First of it was clean, organized and friendly staff. The food was fresh and service was good. Full bar service, they were out of blue moon beer, ketel one vodka which was disappointing when you have a full bar. Few delays at times bringing out drinks, sauces, and napkins.

We had the best experience at CPK in Valencia yesterday evening.  We were there for my son's 22nd birthday.  I am picky, picky, picky when it comes to both food and service, but our waitress, Kelsey, could not have been nicer.  To me, when eating out, the service is equally as important as the food.  Last night we had an AWESOME experience with both! We had a zero wait time to be seated (at 5pm).  We ordered 1 appetizer, 1 salad, 1 pasta and 2 pizzas and shared everything with our group "family" style.  Everything tasted great, and I'm also a good cook so I know what I'm talking about when it comes to food. Anyways, here's an example of what I consider to be going above and beyond "normal" service by wait staff.  The bread and oil were brought to the table, and my (almost) daughter-in-law said to my son "I wish they'd bring out butter."   Our waitress, Kelsey, brought butter to the table without us even directly asking her.  My daughter-in-law, and me, were both very impressed!!!  Kelsey made suggestions on food and offered her opinion on options when we asked for it.  She was always smiling and was as nice as nice could be. Overall, our dinner experience could not have been better.  This made my son's birthday all the much nicer!!  Thank you CPK Valencia!!! High five!!!
Decent food but absolutely takes for ever for them to deliver your simple order. Never ever go here if in a hurry. Will not return to this location.
First time here and it was delicious our waiter was very good! John blake! We enjoyed our food and service was fantastic
The food is great! Fast service & Robbie did good. I come here often and I get my points and get free food. That's the best part of eating out!!!

First time at this location since we moved to Santa Clarita.  I'm happy we decided to have lunch here today.  Since we got to the place the greeted us with a friendly and happy attitude.  They ask what kind of table we prefer, which I responded whichever is available faster.  Two minutes later we where sitting down.  Andrew our waiter ask if it was our first time here, which my son responded yes and he offered a free flatbread, we ordered the Bianco it was good tasting and perfect for my two picky little ones :).  For lunch we ordered a chicken Cesar salad, a five cheese pizza and a garlic cream chicken fettuccine.  I wish I had taken a picture but, everything was gone before I remember.  Lol while we where eating the manager (Josh) came and greet us, asked how everything was going so far.  I have to said that I loved the fact that Andrew was fast, very helpful, friendly and great attitude (happy and smiling at all times but the most he brought our food fast and kept checking on us for our drinks and to take away empty plates from the table.  They definitely gain a new customer.  We'll be back.  And to end it couldn't have got better the manager came again and since my salad didn't got to my table before the food offered us a free dessert (we picked a red velvet by the way delicious).  I couldn't believe it.  Thank you very much Andrew you really made a difference,  we are very happy with your service and great customer service, keep it up .  Nice job Josh you guys are making sure people leave happy and come back.

Excellent food & service by Joshua. Reserved an area for 17 friends & family for a special birthday party & the staff did a terrific job in accomodating our group. Joshua did an outstanding job in providing excellent service for our large party. He is sincere & humble, along with other staff. Food was delicious.

Great feel restaurant.  Service was great.  Food was great.  And the manager, Jared, was very attentive and conversed nicely with my son and I about the food.  We'll try his suggestions next time we visit CPK. BATHROOMS WERE WELL STOCKED AND CLEAN !!!! FIVE STARS !

I have frequented this CPK location on numerous occasions. What keeps me coming back is only the food and NOT the service! Service is ridiculously SLOW from ordering food, getting the bread, getting the check and etc! When you look around there are plenty of employees and it's hardly ever busy, so why the slow service???? Please rectify this issue... It's been going on long enough!
My friend and I love coming here the food is always great and  ruby our waitress was really sweet and on top of her game. Hope we get her again

Every now and then I find myself coming back to CPK time and again. They are obviously doing something right and upon my last visit they really 'wowed" me. My sister, my nephew and I got got seated in their outside patio. Good choice as my nephew can't sit still for too long. My sis and I were able to take turns walking out the little side gate and take him to the man-made pond to feed all the ducks. I'm pretty sure this particular CPK has a lot of overhead with the complimentary bread they serve. Anyway, we only waited about five minutes (maybe less) before the manager came rushing out and apologized for the wait. I think since a nearby table had already complained they had been sitting out there for 10 mins and no one came by, the manager already assumed us to be in the same boat. I didn't mind. So, we got around to ordering: Chicken tequila fettuccine: God, I just love this dish. The richness and the lime, oooh-weee, it's carb-a-licious heaven! Sis got the chicken lettuce wraps... always a good, light and refreshing choice. I half-guiltily enjoyed my pasta and discarded any regrets of remorse because it was so damn good! We also each had a drink before our meal, I went with red wine and she got the strawberry basil mojito? Maybe I'm getting the name wrong, but she liked it. It was refreshing for a hot day and it had a nice kick to it! As were finishing up our meal, the manager comes back out (she'd already checked back on us a few times) to ask if we need any boxes, hands me a dessert menu and says "Pick out a dessert, it's on us as we are sorry to have kept you waiting".  WOW!!! Talk about AWESOME customer service!! I was floored. We weren't trying to get a freebie, but by chance, it fell into our laps!! WHY?? Because...because my friends, that's how you take care of your patrons... by making up for something they felt they were lacking WITHOUT you the patron having to ask for it! AMAZING. Well, thank you kind lady manager. I took note of your hospitality and will definitely talk you up to my friends and fellow Yelpers. But why oh why did you guys have to take away the Greek mediterranean salad and mushroom stuffed ravioli??

Maybe it's location specific or maybe it's CPK as a whole, but the Gluten Free crust was wildly disappointing. As in I couldn't stomache the taste of it and instead peeled off the toppings. I don't think I've had a gluten free crust that bad since the advent of gluten free anything. It was just cardboard. The toppings were good and the curb side delivery guy was nice (albeit the order took forever), but that was one awfully expensive inedible pizza.  Believe it or not, both Dominos and Big Mamas and Papas have great Gluten Free crusts - or buy Udis.
Service was very very good. Food not so much.  Pasta undercooked and cold.  Pizza cold.  Alotta bucks for little taste. Won't be returning.
Andrew  was amazing on his 10th day of work. He rocked. We were a party of 8 & he was Incredible!! The new watermelon/strawberry salad is The best!

Hot day and feeling for a lighter meal so we decided on CPK.  We were seated and waited on promptly with service from multiple wait staff.  Salad was fresh and  tasty with warm fresh rolls directly from the oven.  I enjoyed the sunglasses, SMILES and enthusiasm from our servers.

We went in today for an early lunch after my niece's graduation. There were 13 of us. It took a very long time to get our food. My son ordered the kids pasta with alfredo sauce. They brought out pasta with no sauce. We waited over 30 minutes for them to bring his corrected meal. Meanwhile he ate half of my lunch. My older son ordered a sandwich and salad. They only have him half a sandwich when he had ordered a whole. We ended up asking them to bring the other half in a to go box after waiting over 30 minutes for that. We waited forever for drink refills. The waitress was very apologetic saying that the kitchen was slammed. We most definitely will or return to this place ever again.

2nd time here and it left me feeling meh... My son and his girlfriend had pizza which looked delish. But for the second time ordered something different. Big mistake! I ordered the tacos carnitas. Meat was dry over cooked and flour tortilla was full of grease. If I wasn't so hungry I would have sent it back. I picked at dish which was cold by the time it got to our table. Probably because the meat had been sitting all day. Plus my dish probably sat while the pizzas came out of the oven.  Point of this review is that you should just order pizza here. They look great. The rest of the food isn't even worth the price. And to add my tacos come at a pretty steep price at over 11.00 plus for just 2 cold tacos. I don't think I will return, I will go elsewhere. That's the nice thing about living here. Lots of great food to choose from. Thumbs WAY WAY down sorry!

This is going to be short and sweet. I have been to this particular CPK on numerous occasions, but can never check in due to internet service. I just found out all CPKs have wireless, dumb me. It is always clean, and it always smells great there, you are always greeted by the hostess or host, and  they 99% of the time open the door for you when you come in or out.  Appearance and Atmosphere: 9.5 (They could have told me about wi-fi. LOL) Brooke came by as soon as we sat down to check if we wanted anything to drink, took our drink order, and our appetizer order right away. Before we could order our meal, the appetizers were out. We ordered the Thai Chicken Spring Rolls $8.50. I love these things. Full Thai Chicken Crunch Salad $13.25, enough for 4 people, don't think about ordering it for two unless you haven't eaten in a week, or want leftovers, and the Thai Chicken Pizza $13.00.
