Sliced nicely in 6 pieces, two pieces each and maybe a bowl of salad with the appetizers, there is no room for dessert, but they do have a Belgium chocolate souffle with ice cream thing that is too die for, I just didn't order it, and can't really remember how much it cost. $41.15 for a nice quiet lunch not bad at all. Food : 9(I always forget no onions on the salad and pizza) Customer Service : 10 Overall: 9.5 If it was Friday or Saturday night, this would be a 9 but only because they are packed, food is always consistent and quality is always the same.

I was overjoyed at my most recent trip to my local C.P.K..   I really missed an old appetizer they used to offer (herb onion focaccia).  I always would ask when I came back, hey do you have that again?  Always a polite no. A polite no always left me with a dissapointed and dismissed demeanor. Today the staff chose to alter one of their flatbreads to recall my long missed dish.  It was different, now with truffle oil and the onions rarer than I remember.  It was still quite good but the best thing was the appreciation that I felt. Thank you C.P.K.  and thank you Victoria, Chris, and Jarred.

We just had a GREAT lunch (with leftovers for dinner!) at CPK, Valencia.  The food really was good...but we were most impressed with our server, Jeremy!  He is a naturally gifted people person with warm-hearted and genuine "tableside manner."  Have not been served so well in some very prestigious restaurants.  Had to say something....he was just that terrific!

We went for my wife's birthday. Kyle was our server and he was excellent. He was courteous, attentive, and very friendly. The manager even walked around and talked with us. The food came out extremely fast and drinks never got low.

We got seated real quick. Our server was Chris, a rock star waiter/server. He was cool and super friendly.  I would of given him a 6 star if I could. He was attentive and gave great suggestions.       Chris even got me to open my mind and try more than what I originally came in the for. I must say it was worth every minute and the food was great. Management checked on us and was asking if everything was great.       I highly suggest this establishment to anyone for a fun dining experience.

I found a dead FLY in my salad after I already ate half of it!! The manager was apologetic and offered to bring something else, but being that flies hold millions of germs I completely lost my appetite. She also mentioned that their salads come prepackaged from another vendor and that she would be calling them to see what's going on. Not going back!

One word to describe this place is cheap - in the worst way. We ordered a ham and pineapple pizza and it had three small slices of ham and 7 pieces of pineapple.  But the worst had to be the black bean salad: it was 90% chopped iceberg, about 2 dozen tiny cubed tomatoes and exactly 18 black beans. The black beans were merely a decoration really; how could you possible call this a black bean salad? Final verdict: save your money and eat somewhere else, unless you love pretty plain pizza dough and iceberg ;)

It's another chain restaurant in a city full of chain restaurants but with the kids wanting to eat here, figured there are worse places to eat on a Friday night. We were seated within 15 minutes and greeted by our server just after seating. Our drink order came out quickly and when my beer was empty, she had another waiting for me. For our entire visit, never had a problem with the service being too distant or too intrusive. The problem with the food, and I knew this going in, is that it's really pretty unimaginative. There is no real wow factor or anything else to say other than "I'm full." I've never had a problem with the quality but never have left a CPK saying how great that was. Life is too short to continue this review or think about eating here again in the near future so A-Ok will be it.
DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!  Been going here since it opened and since then the food has gotten worse and the prices goes up. I'd suggest going to Chi Chi's for pizza you get more bang for your buck.
WORST CPK EVER!! I've had too many bad experiences with curb side pick up! One time I waited over an hour for my food and recently my order was never sent to CPK!! I'M DONE! Don't waste your time!

Expect the typical CPK experience. Clean restaurant and courteous staff. I asked for extra chicken on my salad and felt a bit shorted when it came to the table. Seemed like a normal portion, so I reminded the server that I wanted it and he said, yeah that's it. Not a huge deal, but the kind waiter took it off the bill when I looked disappointed. Super cool of him to do that. If you like CPK you will enjoy this one too.

Where should I start.  Everything from the moment we seat down and was introduced to our waiter the night was looking amazing. I don't usually go to cpk however, we where in the area and stopped by. The food was great however, the service was beyond customer service beyond just being nice. Thanks a lot!!!

They have recently had a makeover and the place looks great and the food tastes great!  Drinks are refreshing there too!  Service inside is great!  Take out had problems with their serving sizes!  I ordered a salad and it was  1/2 the size of the order they give you when you sit down!  Not impressed especially when you find that out when you get home!

We love the food at CPK but were exceptionally pleased at the service we received recently from a waitress by the name of Katie. It is always nice to have a pleasant server but she just added to the meal because of her kindness and friendliness. We told the manager and to our surprise he said that she was new. You never would have known that.

Went here to order a pizza to go. Got our BBQ chicken pizza in about ten minutes. It was delicious, but I would leave off the strong onions. This particular CPK had a nice warm environment with nice yellow warm colors. I like the new pizza dough much better.

Great servers, each and everyone  and the host/hostess are superb. Scott the assistant manager is a super person.  The food is always good.and served hot. My wife loves the habanero sauce which rivals any Mexican salsa in this valley. My favorite is the chicken tequila fettuccine. My grandsons love this place and I take then here anytime they ask. A can't miss dining, the planked Salmon rivals any we have had anywhere. Just had a new server, Robbie, he was fantastic, must have been trained by Trevor. A new GM, Susan has just made a great staff even better. Our favorite servers are Trevor and Chris, who know our every want, we highly recommend this establishment. Rumor has it they will be having steak on the menu by spring of 2015. Had to re-do my star rating to 5 stars. The energy that is displayed by Susan has ran into every one of the employees, this place is a fireball of happiness. Brooke,who acts as asst manager when needed and also is the plan your fund raiser person. She is fantastic and gets it done.

So I have not been to CPK in quite a while and after today I am sure it will be a very long time (or possibly never) that I go back. For starters is was so loud in there...I was there for a Friday lunch so I was expecting it to be busy but I could hardly hold a conversation with the people at my table! Then the food came and I have to say I remember it being a lot better. I kept it some with a soup and salad combo. I got the tortilla soup which had an aweful consistency, it was to thick and really did not taste good at all and the Mediterranean salad with chicken and while the salad it's self was ok the chicken was that pressed fake chicken stuff not a real chicken breast. I was very disappointed and hope that no one suggests eating there again!

Can't complain!! Service was exceptional at this location. Came here on a Monday night and got seated right away with 2 kids.Our server was super nice! We ordered the avocado egg rolls and seriously you have to get these! They are super good and the dipping sauce is the perfect touch. I ordered the Barbecue Chicken pizza and it was cooked perfectly. I noticed they don't automatically serve you bread anymore so you just have to ask for it now. They have nice outdoor seating too. Looks like this place can get pretty packed on the weekend nights. Prices are pretty good for what you get. Good location and right next to a cute duck pond. Perfect for little kiddos to feed the duckies. Tip: Save some bread and use that to feed the ducks.
Everytime I go here we sit at the bar. The bartenders are always awesome and friendly. The sangria selection makes me so happy! Keep up he good work guys! You are doing something very right

I used there curb side assistance reciently for lunch. The timing and everything was great, but when I got my Roasted Veggie Salad back to the office, I discovered that I had paid almost $20 and got almost NO Salad! I felt ripped off. The portion size was less than the size of my palm, the dish it was in was very shallow, and there were virtually no roasted veggies. Just 4 shrimp and some avacado! Very disappointing...
The starswberry mango cooler is so good and pairs well with the olive oil dip they give you. Mahi tacos are also really good with the salsa. Service was great for Sunday afternoon.

Came here today with my mom & my daughter and the food was great, as well as the service. Our server was Robbie and he was so nice! When we were about to leave he brought my daughter a sundae to go, because she was behaving so well he said. We come here often but today was by far the best service we've had.
Always great food! Always fast and friendly servers. Frequent chances to menu to keep it from get dull. Although I do miss some of the items when they are removed. Great drinks!!
This place is a must try! Will definitely be coming back. The service was great, the pizza and pasta was outstanding! Loved it

CPK is a great family restaurant for everyone. You can't go wrong with their large selection of pizzas and pasta. I always enjoy their linguini with shrimp and chicken and their spinach artichoke dip for starters.   The kids love their cheese pizzas and because the crust is thin, they are able to finish up.  Curbside ordering is the best I never have to leave my car and they bring the food out to me and take my payment. Great customer service CPK!

Food is good but service is super slow and each time, there's an excuse. Today I went for lunch. I was seated at 2:30 pm exactly. Waiter came right away to take drink order. Food order was not taken until 2:43 pm and bread didn't arrive until 2:50 pm. We waited another 20 minutes for lunch order to arrive.  Not sure what's happening behind the scenes but when you wait 30 minutes to be served a pizza and salad and waiter just smiles and there's no acknowledgment what so ever to the fact that you've spent most of your time there waiting.....major turn off!!

We've ordered takeout here a LOT LESS recently because for some reason, they can never get my order correctly. Not once, not twice, but on too many ocassions. This used to be our go-to place since it is very convenient when you have 2 tired and hungry kids who just want to get home and eat their food after an exhausting day.  I've also spoken to the manager a couple of times because it is just unacceptable when your staff can not fulfill a request (i.e., extra cheese on the side because your kids do  ot like their mac n cheese dry!) and you are paying the same amount of money as you would've elsewhere with better food.  So this past Valentines Day, my kids requested CPK and as much as I was hesitant to give in, I decided to give them another try since it is LOVE day and I'm sure they would do everything to make their customers happy that day. Hmmm...let's just say...I was wrong, unfortunately. Their pastas (I ordered 2 kinds) were VERY DRY and they did not even put sauce on it, but instead put it on the side! I asked for EXTRA sauce on the side for a reason! I didnt get ANY bread nor utensils (I did ask for them during the phone order). My kids didnt even enjoy their mac n cheese that even the leftovers were neglected and thrown away the next day! What a waste of my money! I realize I could've made another call to the manager, but I think that a phone call or two to let them know that there's room for improvement should've already sufficed. I'm just not one who would call to complain, esp when I'm ordering takeout so I can spend more quality time with my family and less in the kitchen! Needless to say, we will not be ordering from this place for years to come...unless ALL restaurants here in SCV are closed and they are the only ones open.  It's too bad this location can't get their stuff right. We love CPK! Just not THIS location.  After many upsetting instances, I know I would much rather drive to other locations (Studio City, Woodland Hills, Northridge)...atleast I know that my family will enjoy our meal.

I have been back to CPK many times. I love their pizza, they are getting better with crust, much softer to eat. Everything is delicious. Can't wait to go back. I really like that they care to open the door for you. Good services.

Wait wait wait wait wait wait ....  We waited for a long time to get a seat outside. Sat at the bar for about 30 mins. No one came to tell us our table was ready.  We had sit at the bar and when we do get the table we wait again. And then I find this hair in my food . Boyfriends pizza was cold after all that.  It's our anniversary.

We came here between Christmas and New Years. The service was AWFUL. We were seated at a table that wasn't wiped down and had no silverware, napkins, or plates. Took 15 minutes just to get our nonalcoholic drinks. No water.  We asked to have our salad before the pizza; instead we got pizza first. It was a margarita pizza - half the pizza had nothing on it and it was burned on the bottom. When the salad finally came, it had the wrong cheese in it, the chicken tasted weeks old, and the lettuces tasted like dirt. Nasty! Had to ask for napkins/silverware/plates - really? Manager tried to make things right by getting another pizza, but it was just as bad as the first one - actually burned worse.  Meanwhile the "cooks" were yukking it up and not paying any attention to their tasks at hand.  This place needs one of those "restaurant rescues." It was awful. Don't go here.
every great like usual.  Wonderful pizza.  Great pea soup and yummy lettuce wraps
Great food and service.  I have eaten at this location several times for lunch.  Very consistent.

Today my family decided to celebrate my baby daughter's fifth birthday at the California pizza kitchen Valencia. It had been some years since my family had sat down and had dinner at CPK Valencia. We were warmly greeted and seated promptly. Our service was attentive and professional. I was impressed by the manager Efren who I saw make an effort to speak to everyone in my section. Efrin also advised us of discounts and memberships. I was given a good night as I exited the restaurant by one of the staff delivering to curbside. This was a very positive experience for me  at a corporate restaurant.

What a disappointment.... This place does not deserve to have its California Pizza Kitchen title. I've been to at least 10 CPK's and this is by far the worst.  I should have given this place one star, but the manager tried his best to fix the problem. Arrival: the appetizer plates are ALL dirty! Food spots on all.... 50 MINUTES AFTER WE ORDER: Our order was brought out, my avocado egg rolls are burnt.... Server: did not cone to check on us but once during our long visit.

Came here for dinner , the service was great by Andy and his team .my tacos were little cold I mentioned to Andy and he immediately order one more order , was not a big deal but they took initiative to make me happy or satisfied with my experience! Thanks guys keep the good work , I will definitely come back

Another night out to CPK with my wife Susan and another great experience. We love the friendly atmosphere at this restaurant and tonight was no exception. Our server, Tiffany went out of her way to make us feel at home. The food was excellent as always; fresh and very tasty. We started with the usual tortilla spring rolls which are over the top good, and then went on to a pizza that was also delicious. All in all a positive and very enjoyable time. Would recommend CPK to anyone looking for a great dinner experience. - Cheers!

We came here for Father's Day! Since it's my Dad's favorite place to eat. He loves the shrimp wrap! I ordered the new Ribeye steak with potatoes and greens. The steak was topped with garlic butter that melts with every bite. The steak was a good portion and a great bargain for the price. We also got the fish tacos, Hawaiian pizza and California salad with assorted fruits. Every thing we ordered were very good and comes in generous portions. Lastly, don't forget to order the chocolate soufflé for dessert ala mode. CPK is always a solid choice for dinner!
Love the excellent array of pizzas, and all were excellent. Server was quick and friendly, and the mixed drinks were fantastic. We celebrated two birthdays, and the dinner was fun and relaxing.

Worst service ever! Have visited 3 times, and have had bad service each time.  First time, my elderly mother in law accidentally spilled her specialty drink, and they said they would have to charge her for a new one. She was nearly in tears from embarrassment! Second time was a work lunch with a large group and everyone's plates came out at different times. One person had to take her stuff to go because we ran out of time. Last and final time, came on a Saturday afternoon, and the restaurant was empty. Took at least fifteen minutes to get seated, then once seated, we were neglected by our waitress, and end up leaving because our kids got restless after being there an hour and still not having all our food. Manager did apologize and comped our two items we did eat, which was nice. But a little too late for me. Sadly for me, I won't try again.
They added a new lunch duo menu, which is awesome. You choose a mini-entree, soup or salad and a beverage.

I don't come here often and I don't know why since its down the street from my house. Had the fish tacos today and they were delicious!! I only gave 4 stars because I haven't eaten her a lot...but so far so good.

The food was great, nice setting by a duck pond and outdoor seating. The best part of this CPK was the service. From the hosts, to the bus boys and to the servers, the staff literally ran thru the restaurant serving the customers. It made us tired watching them. They worked like a team and were so pleasant. A shout out to Trevor who was funny, accommodating, attentive and all around a fantastic server. He made our dining experience fantastic! For some reason all of the employees were super attractive!

my faves are the arugula quinoa salad and the artichoke and asparagus and spinach spaghettini. So good. I also like the roasted veggie salad and the spinach artichoke dip. the service is sometimes great, sometimes not so great. i hardly ever order pizza. If you sign up for their rewards program or whatever it's called, you sometimes get free appetizers and discounts. I like how they have the pickup service where you call in your order and then you can opt to wait in your car while they bring it out to you. Convenient if you're a mom and you don't want to schlep your kids out of the car just to pick up a to go order.

Only a few gluten-free choices available, mostly salads. However, Caramelized Peach Salad with Salmon is outstanding and one of our favorite salads in town. I could have that everyday! From my understanding, they use to offer a GF pizza crust, but there were cross contamination concerns. Totally understandable. Very pleasant staff.  A tad bit expensive though.

If you want delicious food with fast and friendly service to match, this is the place! Me and my bf came here for the first time, it was busier than we thought it would be, forgetting that it was a Friday night. I was impressed right when we walked in... there was an employee standing at the door opening and closing the doors for the people coming and going, smiling/greeting/saying goodbye, I thought that was cool. At the hostess stand we were told it would be about a 5 to 10 min wait. It took pretty much exactly 5 min and we were seated. Then our server janelle came by, and she was amazing! She was super bubbly, helpful, and attentive. Stopping by our table often, suggesting dishes and drinks, and when we told her it was our fist time here she even came back and surprised us with a complimentary appetizer! One that we wanted to try but didn't end up ordering so we got to try it anyway! She also told us about a free loyalty program they have and seeing as how great the experience was I figured we would def be coming back, so I downloaded the app at the table. When you check in at the location, the app gives you a code to redeem to your server, so you can keep track of your spending, for every $100 spent, they give you a $5 credit back, also, first time users get a free appetizer, when I showed her the code she applied it and the free appetizer as well, so we got both our appetizers for free! We even ended up ordering dessert [the salted caramel pudding, yum] and while we were finishing up dessert, the manager, who's name was jake, came by to welcome us, and ask us how our first time was. Needless to say, we left with [overly] full stomachs, smiles on our faces, not that big of a dent in the wallet at all [especially after all the awesome freebies!] And we will def be coming back!

Every time we eat here, I get the Miso Shrimp Salad. It's so good! It's light and healthy tasting, but so tasty with the avocado all mixed in. The portions are on the small side. The quality of the food is yummy- for example their spaghetti bolognese is quite good even though you'd think their specialty would be pizza, and that a place like Olive Garden should serve better tasting pasta than CPK but no it's totally the other way around.  The prices are on the high side for the amount of food. We're usually not totally satiated unless we're eating here not all that hungry in the first place. And then our bill is quite on the higher side of what we like to spend on a typical night out. So this tends to be a problem, and why we don't visit very frequently. We get the meal gift cards at a discount at Costco. That helps. If you go when it's really nice out, then either before or after your meal you can walk around and look at the ducks or sit on one of their benches and enjoy the weather or take a stroll over the little bridge and peer into the man-made lake. Today we saw a mother duck watching over its 4-5 babies feeding on earthworms or critters in the dirt. So cute.
Pizzas were average. The Red Velvet Cake was amazing!

Service was pretty good for Saturday night. We had a party of 15 and they don't take reservations, but told me to call an hour before we wanted to be there. When we arrived the table was ready and everyone was very nice and friendly.    Soy ginger dumplings were great. Meat craver pizza was amazing. Everyone seemed to really enjoy all the food.

i love there pizza and there pizza is really good i wish they could open 5 of california pizza kitchen in valencia and i wish i could own because it is really good pizza and if you are going out to dinner you should go to yes California pizza kitchen

Avoid the so called "Curbside Service" at the Valencia Bridgeport Marketplace location of CPK. My wife and I frequent this location on a regular basis for both in restaurant and food to go. The food quality and prep has always been great , however last night 2/28/2015 , the food was terrible. We ordered our usual , chopped salad and spinach pizza . The pizza was burned on the bottom, and the salad contained 8-10 micro cubes of chicken with wilted lettuce , and five micro shreds of salami, $14.00 for that ? Really ? My point is that this would have never been presented inside the restaurant like this. Best bet is to go inside and pick up your food, so you can confirm the condition ,and quality of your order. We are not looking for anything , due to the fact we were so hungry we ate some of the food.
I usually never write a yelp so I'm going to keep this short and sweet. Great experience. Mark handled our table of 17 so well, definite recommendation.
Services was pretty good!  But food... ;( Spaghetti w tomatoes too much oil and sour.  No bread w pastas.  Not Italian home pasta.
We are frequent visitors of CPK. The new host, Josh, is great!! He is friendly and always has a smile on his face! He hurries to open the door for guests and makes your visit enjoyable!

Right after then President Clinton visited the island I went to California Pizza Kitchen at the mall in Hawai'i and it was fantastic! The most innovative pizza I had ever tried.  I was so pleased to find a place that made little kid pizzas with whole wheat crust - so when I was in Santa Clarita I stopped by this location of the franchise and it was so like Denny's I couldn't believe it. It was noisy.  Service was so-so.  The menu had changed, there was no Thai style pizza, unless that had only been a Hawai'i thing. I guess any restaurant, even a place at the mall in Hawai'i is going to look prettier than a place on the mainland - but still - I was disappointed with the very plain decor, the cheap looking lighting fixtures.  For what you get the pizza seems overpriced. On the plus side you can easily find a parking space.  It's on the way out of Santa Clarita no near the crazy traffic jam that centers around their mall.

I've been to this location twice since we moved to Santa Clarita and it's been great both times.  The food is really good, and service has been excellent.  The last time we went, our server was Chris, and he was FANTASTIC.   Seriously, one of the best servers ever.  The manager, the hostess ... everyone one great.  I would go there just for the people who work there.

I've honestly never received consistently poorer service in Santa Clarita then from this CPK. Take-out orders are always wrong or poorly prepared with overcooked children's meals, wrong pizza toppings, wrong salad toppings, not enough dressings, wrong drinks, etc.. While dining in the service is extremely in-efficent with incompetent servers disappearing for more than 10 minutes at a time after promising to be right back with drink re-fills or additional requested meal items.  I would never step foot in here except that my wife and daughter are CPK fans. This location though is quickly curing them of this ailment. The only reason I'm not not giving one star is that atleast this CPK staff delivers terrible service with a smile. Kindness counts for something. If your looking for a better family option with consistently better food, service, and value then I highly recommend Stonefire Grill on Cinema Drive or Corner Bakery on the corner of Valencia & McBean Pkwy. Both of these restaurants are light years ahead of this CPK.

Friday Night February 13, 2015 my wife and I were seated outside on the patio The first contact was a friendly young man who asked if we wanted the heater on, he adjusted it to my wife's pleasure. Next our server, Kelsey, was quick to ask us for our drink order, and was gracious to take a quick picture on my phone camera of my wife and I to celebrate Valentines Day. She shared the new menu options, new drink options, and other highlights. She suggested the Valentines Sweet Deal for 2. I asked to stagger each of the item and she replied, "To make it a 4 course meal, right." I knew she would make this dining experience great. The food arrived as the right time, each time, at the right temp, taste, and portion. We asked for containers throughout the meal for the leftovers and she was quick to take the large plates off and return with our food boxed up. Overall her service was great. We also were met by the Manager, Scott, who asked if we needed anything, how our service and food was, and was kind enough to offer some suggestions for dessert and new menu items that are coming soon. I really appreciated the attention to detail that Kelsey and Scott gave to me and my wife, I even posted the service we received on Facebook. Even with our busy schedules I know my wife and I look forward to visiting again in the next month.

Been here twice now and had one previous experience at a CPK (in Burbank, across from IKEA). In my three visits, I've tried three different pizzas: Thai Chicken, Pear & Gorgonzola, and Wild Mushroom, all of which were insanely delicious. It's hard to pick a favorite, but if I had to, I'd go with the Pear & Gorgonzola, which came with a tasty garden salad on top (never seen that before). Additionally, the toasted macadamias were a nice touch. I've always been a huge fan of the avocado rolls at BJ's, but the ones here are even better! So good. The mango mojito is also a new favorite. This place has been incredibly busy since its opening but the new staff is doing a great job; everyone is really friendly and attentive. Can't wait to come back and try different pizzas!

I love the location of this CPK.  The inside is really nice with a huge bar.  There is also a really awesome outdoor patio where you can sit and look at the neighboring pond with ducks!  The CPK menu has really evolved over the recent months to include many different types of pizza, including thin crust and flat breads with unique ingredients, salads and appetizers.  There is truly something for everyone in every price point.  My only complaint about this location is the service is sometimes slow outside.  Other than that, this CPK is great!

We cannot quite figure it out... The staff seems weird...like zombies or some kind of apocalyptic takeover... We tried several times to go there but the service is just...weird... The food is blah and did I say weird?

We were seated promptly and greeted by our server. The drink order was taken and delivered. Our meal started with the Chips & white corn guacamole with a side of the hot salsa. Next we shared the Spring salad and finished the meal with the Carnitas taco's. The food was great and the service even better. The Manager Scott stopped by and was very inquisitive regarding the meal.  WHY oh WHY did corporate ever do away with the habenero salsa, was our total favorite item. Possibly the most gregarious, superb, outstanding bartender / server in this valley is Treavor, a true gem.

We had a really lovely lunch here.  We started with the asparagus and arugula salad, which was bright and tasty.  Loved the vinaigrette dressing and the sweet sun-dried tomatoes.  We also had their focaccia bread starter, warm and yummy.   My friend and I also shared their wild mushroom pizza.  I'm allergic to walnuts, but they were able to make the pizza with a marinara sauce instead of the walnut pesto sauce which normally comes with that pizza. For years, my cousins and friends have raved about CPK and how much they love it.  I have always had good experiences at CPK, but never understood their enthusiasm.  This was my first visit to the Valencia location, and if they can replicate the great lunch I had on this visit, I will finally share all the enthusiasm everyone always expresses for CPK.

This review is for the catering take-out order I placed for today 8/19/2015. Not only was I impressed with the food presentation, sandwiches, salads and dessert, but I really want to focus on the customer service I received by this gem in the community Sean. Sean works the take-out counter (I think) and worked with me from beginning to end. He took my call yesterday and was professional and patient as I expressed my concern based on past experiences with other restaurants in the community. I bring lunch in for my executives often (at least twice a week) and feeding them is part of my job that I take personally. If the food or order is wrong, then it looks bad on me. Over and over again, I can not tell you how many times either something is missing (see my other reviews) or something is wrong. Not in this case... Sean walked me through the order and PERSONALLY guaranteed the order would be correct and incredible. It was. When I arrived, Sean greeted me at the door and put his hand out to shake my hand. For a 22 year old, this is IMPRESSIVE. He walked me to the take out counter and began to show me the food... some of it he noted that he prepared himself. He carefully bagged my items, making sure that I was clear on everything he labeled, and everything he promised... all along with the biggest smile on his face.  I drove away literally feeling like I had just experienced something special. What a joy I had in my heart (drama I know but I'm serious) I had knowing that SOMEWHERE, the idea of excellent service still exists, even in the mind of a millennial... no offence. But THAT'S rare! I have already reached out to the corporation via their "contact us" option on the website to let them know that THIS KID DESERVES A PROMOTION! Whatever he is going to do in life, he is going to be great at it. He's just one of those kids.  I will go back, again and again, as long as I keep getting this kind of service with this kind of food. Oh, and if you are thinking about using them for corporate catering... get the large sandwich combo with the two salads and the dessert platter. It's amazing and totally worth the low price! I am at this moment feeding 20 hungry executives for just over $200. Seriously... now that's a great form of advertising right there!

My kids have food allergies.  Tonight, we gave CPK a try for their gluten-free pizza, and we were very impressed. They use what seem to be almost clean-room conditions for preparing the gluten-free pizza. Products are handled in a separate kitchen area and the food preparers wear rubber gloves while making your meal. The food is brought to the table by the store manager so they can certify that it is in fact a gluten-free dish. It's nice to see a chain restaurant take things like this so seriously. And it tastes good, too.
Staff and management always friendly. Chris and Kahlina are great servers. Food is good and prices very fair.

I've always loved CPK. I love pizza and I love innovation, and CPK always has both. This location is beautiful. I've passed by many times but have never stopped by. I'm glad I did. There's a lot to do in this shopping center and the location is majestic and has great views. When I stopped in with a friend, the restaurant wasn't too busy. We were greeted instantly and the hostess was very friendly. The restaurant itself was decorated in typical CPK fashion, but this location was far more beautiful inside (and outside) than the others I have visited. Our server, Jared, was great. We weren't at the table two minutes before he took our drink orders. Around five minutes later he took our food order after bringing our drinks. He was friendly as well. When I go to CPK, I like to try whatever new pizzas are on the menu. My staples (that you can never go wrong with) are the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza, Cheeseburger pizza, Chipotle Chicken pizza, California Club pizza, and the Thai pizza. This time, I tried the Habanero Carnitas pizza on honey wheat crust. This one was good, I'd give it a B+/A-. The pizza came out perfectly cooked and the toppings were evenly spread. The habanero salse came on the side, which hit me as weird at first but made complete sense. Unfortunately, that's where the pizza lost some points. The salsa was bland and definitely not spicy, which was disappointing. I'm a sucker for spice so luckily, my old girlfriend Cholula, came to the rescue. The carnitas were great on top, the cheese and sauce were perfect and the crust was a delicious, slightly sweet addition to the whole thing. I'm pretty satisfied. Overall, the experience here was great. I'll definitely be back for the views, service, and food.

I ordered the roasted peach salad for lunch with added chicken.  The chicken smelt awful and had gone bad.  I picked it off the salad and told the Manager who really didn't seemed to care at all.  They took the price of the chicken off the bill.  It just spoiled my lunch with my husband, we rarely get to go for lunch mid week. I will never go back.  The service is meh and the place is bland and boring.  What a miserable little place.

Well I've now eaten here three time and it's good. I've eaten pizzas and salads mostly and all in all good. Not sure how you cod give it anything below a four star. There drinks are good, not spectacular but again it's more of a family place. If your going here to drink and hang with friends like you would at a bar, then this is not the place for you. But if your interested in good food at decent prices I suggest this place if your out and about and need some grub.

Pizza crust appears machine produced.  OK if you're desparate for pizza that tastes like a cracker!  CPK is overrated.  A once trendy place to eat.  There are better pizza type restaurants like MOD Pizza.

You have certain, usually lower, expectations when eating at chain restaurants. This CPK exceeded all pre-existing notions. We were the only table seated outside, and the service was perfect. Our server Brandon was quick and friendly, all of our courses showed up at the perfect times, and the food was good. I typically avoid chain restaurants but I will be back here soon. Great job!
I enjoy the experience here. Attentive staff, good food. The lettuce wraps are delicious and I've liked all the salads I've tried. Also the mushroom pizza is good.

I have only been to this one twice. The first time was not too bad. The second time was probably my last.  The pizza was definitely sub par. And the staff was all over the place and not at my table. Correction they were near my table behind me at one of the order computers and they were just standing there chatting very loudly behind my head. It was more distressing than eating at a fast food place which is saying a lot. Maybe the whole chain is like this not quite sure.

One of my favorite restaurants ever, especially this one in Santa Clarita. Really great atmosphere! Great for families AND dates!  I have never ordered something from this place that I didn't like! The chinese chicken salad, BBQ chicken pizza, and key lime pie are the hands down best on the menu. I get excited just thinking about them. The waiters are always in a good mood. Very prompt and proffessional. LOVE this place!!!

We had a good time because we were with friends and the waitress was pretty cool BUT, dinner came out after  an hour and half and  all 3  halibut so dinners were over cooked and dry. CPK should be ashamed to only comp 1 halibut, but hey We learned something- to never go back.

Just a bad dining experience.  The food took forever (and at the time there was only three other tables).  Had to ask for drink refills repetitively. When the food for my child and I arrived, it had long black hairs wrapped in it. The waitress was simply going to cancel the order instead of having it remade.  It was our lunch, so I demanded it get remade. Took close to 20 minutes to have it brought back to the table.  Never once did the manager (who was too busy chatting with the employees and greeting customers at the door) come to apologize. This location is just  a classless establishment.

Maybe I just come here on the wrong days and at the wrong time, but my dining experiences here don't tend to be all that great. It has a convenient location, but the food and customer service could improve.
I see this location getting only 3 stars which I am shocked by. We went on a Sunday the place was packed. We got our food very quickly and it was amazing. Highly recommend.

My family likes CPK but service sucks. The waiter spilled soda on my daughter and didn't even give us a discount on our food. Poor customer service. Will not return!!!  I will not recommend this place to anyone.

The CPK in the Bridgeport Marketplace is gorgeous, with a killer view of the "fake-lake", with its ducks, wooden bridge, and metal statues of sailboats and seagulls.  The Good - The Caesar salad was very good. Tasty dressing, crunchy garlicky croutons, and huge shaved slices of Parmesan cheese. The Chicken Tequila Fettuccine pasta was also excellent. And different. I don't think I've ever seen it anywhere else. Spinach fettuccine with peppers and tequila-lime/jalapeño cream sauce. Probably the best thing on the menu. The Bad - The hostess was a joyless, indifferent 20-something that obviously understood the importance of making a good first impression. Not! And what they call bread was (as usual) cold, hard, tasteless slices of day-old cardboard with virtually non-spreadable rock hard frozen butter.  The Ugly - The "P" in CPK stands for Pizza, so we ordered what the waitress said was a pretty popular pizza - Thai Chicken Pizza. Unfortunately, the pizza was pretty nasty. It was dry, tasted "weird", and, if not for the toppings, was pretty indistinguishable from the day-old bread. (If you want a truly excellent Thai Chicken pizza, go to Wolf Creek just up the street.) Dear CPK, you may want to change your name to California "Pasta" Kitchen 'cuz the Pizza thang ain't happening.
Family with screaming kid ahhhhhh. Server paid so much attention to this LOUD family we were ignored. Food cold, pizza dry and water never refilled. Just an awful experience.

I don't see what people like about this place. It's overpriced, and I can't find anything on the menu. My husband and I came here because someone gave us a gift card. We spend $47 on a $15 meal. It was terrible. Pizza is nothing but crust. Salads were all iceberg. I came back to finish off the gift card, and got the field greens salad. Healthy green lettuce would have been good if it was fresh, crunchy pears, and sugar-coated pecans. It was like eating candy on a salad - yuk! We won't be back.
Friendly staff and good food. We were there around 11 am on a Sunday and there was no wait time. Parking is plenty in the strip mall.

I'd really say I'd rate it more like 3.5 stars. We usually stop in for a late lunch or early dinner on the weekends. The food quality is typical of a chain restaurant, lots of variety, hefty servings, tons of calories, etc. I'm glad they added the small bites menu. I'll usually get a wedge salad and explore the menu and split an entree with my honey. I like my pizza a bit crispier but the thin crust feels like I'm eating a cracker and the regular pizza tastes a bit dough-ee at times. We usually opt for the pasta selections, bolognese is our favorite. Lately it seems like everyone else does too.  My biggest DISAPPOINTMENT is that they played with the menu and took off the Banana chocolate cake/torte dessert.  Another side note...I was introduced to this DELICOUS dessert when I came in for a half salad and I must have had this unsatisfied look on my face. When they put the calorie counts on the menu they couldn't put in the usual amount of salad dressing cuz of the calorie counts. And the once shrimp and crab miso salad was now just a shrimp salad for the same price...so they threw in a dessert for free. Oh and we prefer the bar to the tables...service is better and we like the waiter/bartenders. They're attentive!
Last few visits have been great, service seems to have improved significantly and I love the cedar plank salmon!

Our appetizer came before our beer. We asked why it is taking so long and was told by our waitress that the guy pouring drinks is busy waiting tables. 20 minutes later it came. Waited and waited for the soup and had to ask for it to come before the pizza. I just wanted to leave. Certainly not coming back, it was not even that busy but I think because it was raining, someone brilliant sent people home early.

I recently went to CPK for a quick lunch. I didn't want to wait forever to get a pizza so I opted for a salad instead. I ordered their Waldorf Chicken Salad (minus the chicken, added grilled shrimp instead).  I love this salad, especially with the Dijon balsamic vinaigrette. I got the half order and that got me really full. It is a tad on the salty side, but being one of those people who add packs of salt and pepper to everything, I loved it. However, at $9.49 (+$4.75 in my case because of the shrimp) plus tax, it is on the pricer side for a quick meal.  FYI: Try ordering online in advance. It'll save you a lot of time.

Great outdoor seating at this location. Ample parking, and they take reservations. Everything I got here was delicious. That's because it is high in salt and fat.  Love the avocado rolls and the white pizza. Delicious! By the way, did you ever notice that the Roman Numerals for forty (40) are '"XL"?  Check please...

I love their crawfish jambalaya pasta thing. It is soooooo good. I love going here because the staff is always on point. They bring a second glass of water even before my glass is empty! Their 3/4 cheese pizza with tomato and basil is also really good just make sure you add pepperoni! I love CPK. Yum yum yum!
TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE. A long red hair was in the middle of my salad. It made me want to vomit. I will never go back here!!

i seldom go to a CPK since the closes one to me is at Brea  and i seldom dine out over that way.  today we're up here visiting a friend and her family.  i ordered their chinese chicken salad which was ok.  i've tasted better versions of this meal in the long beach area.  my kids were ok with their kids alfredo pasta dishes.  and my friend liked her thai salad.  her daughter also enjoyed her bbq chicken pizza.   the ambience was nice.  very family friendly, which i liked dining with my kids.  i love the outdoor scenery.  i forgot what the mini bridge outside was called.  they have a good size duck pond outside which also had some seating.  it was nice to walk and sit down at the white benches after having dinner.  felt like i was in a different place and time:)

I haven't been to this cpk ever since it opened due to the bad reviews on yelp, or at least not on our top of the list picks.  We finally decided to go, and to my surprises, the food is good with great service and nice outside seating atmosphere.  I like the salads and pastas. I would say there pizza is good, but I would enjoy it more if it is a little more crunchier.   I give this a five stars, because of the services and innovative foods that are on the menu. I think I fell in love with their Tuscan Panzanella Salad. I have never lasted something so good and out of the world, certainly not from a pizza chain. I will definitely go back.

Started off ok. Then went down hill. Server forgot to put in 2 orders so we waited 15 min for those and never saw the mgr. until we paid the bill. I would have expected someone right away to resolve the problem. Guess I was wrong. We like the food and the atmosphere here and will be back. Hope it doesn't happen twice!
Finally returned...this time the service was excellent...very attentive.  The pizza was delicious. Drinks were refilled promptly.  All around good experience.  So, we will be back!
Great and fast service and their mojito is one of the best that I've ever had!  and I'm a mojito #hore!

Great food at a reasonable price. We had Tani as our server and she made the trip worthwhile. The Arugula salad is a very good stater.  The Tequila fettuccine is great and half the price of Bella Cucina. They now have berries and cream that is to die for. I will be a regular patron.

I have to admit that I tend not to like corporate sorts of restaurants where they appear to have focus tested their food and their server behavior (one shoulder touch equals five percent more tip!), but this place isn't bad. Service can be uncannily slow for routine things (drink refills), but the two salads i have tried are delicious (roasted vegetable salad w/grilled chicken added and the Morrocan chicken salad). Just please stop with the touching. We do not know each other that well.
Good food good service fair price always consistent cpk

The food was good, especially the caramelized pear salad, but the service for my to-go order was TERRIBLE! This Cali. Pizza Kitchen location has a dedicated to-go order area inside, so one might think they are proficient at these kinds of orders. Nope! I really should have been a jerk and been like "okay, I see my order is bagged up, but you need to take it all out and prove to me that all the food is there." Upon returning to the office, I soon discovered that a full salad was missing, and only the roasted vegetable part of the "roasted vegetable salad" was included. So basically three salads were missing. Although my food was good, it's not worth incurring the wrath of unhappy coworkers when CPK happily charges you for your full order but forgets to include 20% of that order. There are plenty of other pizza joints in town to consider as an alternative.....

Numero Uno, Dominos, Pizza Hut, Guido's, McPizza (you remember that?). This is a list of pizzas that are far and away better than the yuppified status of the CPK. Went about a week ago and once again the franchise did not disappoint. The pizza I ordered came out with a crisp tasteless crust with marginal quality toppings/ingredients. I already knew what I was getting myself into before I walked in so I can't really blame the restaurant, but I will say that like BJs, Kabuki, Salt Creek, Elephant Bar, CPK has found the holy grail of SCV food. Make it REALLY half assed and people will pay a premium!

At long last, the wait is over to have yet ANOTHER chain restaurant open in Valencia. Don't let my sarcasm throw you off. I really do like CPK.  The BFF and I came here last night. They have been open for a week so far and holy shit are they busy. The wait to be seated was 45 minutes to an hour, but we were lucky enough to spot two seats at the bar and snagged them right away. They have tons of employees, and for the customer load, they need it. It still took 45 minutes to get our food, but that was because the kitchen was so backed up.  Why am i giving them 5 stars, you ask? Simply because they have potential. I did not expect to get seated right away, nor did I expect to eat within the first 20 minutes of being there. This is a new chain restaurant in Santa Clarita, and patience is a virtue.  Dinner was excellent, and our server, Scott, was very nice. I had the Moroccan Chicken Salad. It was amazing. Thinly sliced Moroccan-spiced chicken breast, dates, butternut squash, beets, avocados, almonds, romaine lettuce and cranberries tossed in a champagne vinaigrette. The salad was a complex mix of flavors that really worked well together. Tami got the Goat Cheese and Roasted Pepper Pizza. I didn't try it, but it looked really good. It had carmalized onions and roasted eggplant on it. Yum!  All in all, I really enjoyed my experience. If you dont want to wait, I suggest waiting a few weeks until the initial crowd dies down.
IF YOU PAID WITH A CARD, CHECK YOUR MONTHLY STATEMENT, THEY MAY HAVE PADDED YOUR TIP. good thing I reconcile every month and keep all my receipts.

mmm delicious frozen? pizza... dunno but the pizza is still bomb, from all the wide range of toppings and combos, and the pastas are great! love finding cpk in my local supermarket too! its like white castle...except we actuall have a cpk aroundhere...next up! white castle!

I'm surprised by all the negative reviews of this CPK.  It seems like most mention the terrible service they got while dining there but I personally didn't experience this at all.  Maybe I went there on a good night... who knows, but I'll base this review on my last visit there.  The food here is good... typical CPK food and if you've been to one you've pretty much been to the other CPK restaurants.  I thought my angel hair pasta with shrimp was done well as well as the little arugula salad I ordered that came from their small plates menu.  My mom's jerk chicken pizza was too sweet for my taste but overall it wasn't bad.  As far as service goes, we were served promptly.  The food arrived in good time and our drinks were always refilled.  Nothing to complain about from my experience dining here.

My husband and I come here often. We love there half salads. They are quite large for being half salads. I also like that they use real mixed greens so you get a variety of healthy lettuce.  We always get quick service and leave very satisfied. We don't get pizza or pasta here so I can't speak to those items. The salads are the best around.
It seems new owners are scheduled to run this place. The wife and I went on 08/17/12 noticeable improvement. The new manager walking around to the introducing himself and asking questions.

Wow, A great location, not even a Saturday night and boy was it screwed up! My companion's salad came back wrong twice, it took FOREVER to get any food and we weren't the only ones, I had to get up and ask for things twice, and we weren't even compensated for things taking so long. Apparently, judging from other reviews at this location, it's a chronic problem. Service was the worst I had experienced in a long time! So, goodbye CPK! You were one of the best chains at one time but no longer!

Poor, poor, CPK.  Oh how I loved thee, but then you decided to kick me in the nuts.  What the hell happened?  Simi Valley location? Amazing.  Northridge location, still pretty damn decent.  SCV?  Horrible.  /review.

I have been there a couple of times where is was average.  The pizza on these visits was overpriced, but reasonably good.  I went again on yesterday and it was terrible.  If based on yesterday it would have only gotten one star but I am adding one on past memories.  I think the problem is thin crust pizza's don't age well and we were given cold pizza that seemed to have sat around.  The thin crust pizza was not crisp like a cracker but rather soggy and flaccid. Everything else about the pizza was also marginal. The were stingy with the toppings and they did not taste fresh.  I honestly think the pizza I have gotten at Costco is much better.

Alyse i believe our waitress was named, rocked it out on customer service, very attentive and always at our service. The cobb salad came to me in all the right pieces, made fresh and ripped. The cleanliness of the facility was nice as well, nothing on the floor with all table cleaned and tidy. Most definately one of my favorites in valencia.

Having a sweet kiddo bday party catered by CPK - and they get an immediate 5 stars for having awesome customer service in their catering department. The catering manager went above and beyond to give me the very best deal possible. It is always so rewarding to deal with peeps that appreciate your business, and treat you as such.

I was very excited when Santa Clarita got a CPK. It's one of my faves for a quick but not fast food type dinner. This location is horrible. I used the curbside service twice. Each time they got the order wrong. The food was cold. The pasta was dry even though I requested extra sauce and both times they forgot utensils and bread & butter and napkins! And I requested these items each time.  I'd rather drive to the Northridge location.

I love CPK frozen pizzas. You know what you're getting. It's not what I expect from "pizza", but it's CPK pizza. Garlic chicken is my favorite, but the frozen tastes near identical to what's served in the restaurant, so I can't bring myself to order pizza in the restaurant. I went on a Friday evening and was surprised by how many people were waiting to be seating! It's CPK, right? We waited about 25 mins and then got a table. Atmosphere is nice inside. The outdoor seating has misters, misting water at you while you eat.. which is a little icky. I would never eat out there while water is misting at me and my food. I ordered the Grilled Dijon Chicken Fococcia Sandwich. It sounded delicious, it even looked delicious. Then I had a bite... I didn't taste any dijon except in one corner of the sandwich that was saturated in it far too much. The chicken was dry and the fococcia bland. It definitely left something to be desired. Others in my group ordered the BBQ chicken pizza, Broccoli Sun-Dried Tomato Fusilli, and the Meat Cravers pizza. They all liked their food, but overall it seemed overpriced for average food.
Love the Wild mushroom pizza on Thin crust! I almost never went back here after they X'd the Singapore shrimp rolls!

Four hungry women and an hour to eat! Our server, Erin, this past Tuesdayt evening, was right on top of the table (figuratively speaking, of course) and made sure that our every request (there were a number of them) was taken care of and quickly! I enjoyed the Morrocan Chicken Salad and, although it could have been a bit more spicy, t'was very fresh tasting as was the Champaigne dressingf! My other dining partners enjoyed the BBQ Chicken salad and one other dish (cannot recall) and, though the restaurant had become quite busy with a supper crowd, our checks came out quickly and we were out in an hour. Did I mention...the host who seated us accommodated us with just the right table!

We stopped by for lunch on a casual Wednesday afternoon, thinking there would be no wait as it was a weekday and schools weren't out yet. The waitress saying the wait would be 45 minutes would normally make any hungry pregnant women run screaming for the nearest fast food place, but we stayed and waited. Why?? Because the hostess was SO nice and polite and friendly, she made it seem like the wait would be worth it. And that was just the start of it. The young man that sat us looked like he was only 16 or 17, but he was probably the most polite "teenager" I have come across in Valencia. I sat down feeling very impressed and our waitress didn't let us down either.  I have always loved the food at CPK (we are Burbank regulars) and knew that it would be just as good here. The BBQ chicken Hawaiian pizza was right on par as was the Thai Crunch Chicken Salad. The fifth star here really was for the high level of service. We will definitely be back!

I came to this CPK a while back expecting a great pizza.  After all, isn't that what they're famous for?   We split a couple of appetizers which were decent.  When our pepperoni & mushroom pizza came, I started to take a slice from the pan.  When I lifted up the slice of pizza, I couldn't believe the amount of liquid (not just a couple of drops) that was in the center of the pizza pan.  The liquid was a pool in the center of the pan and made most of the entire pizza soggy and very unappetizing.  We should have sent it back but we hardly saw any wait-staff after the order came.  We didn't eat most of the pizza, paid our bill, and said "never again."  Too bad since they're in a good location at Bridgeport Marketplace.

Meh. Service was good but food was whatever for the price. Cost almost 40 bucks for two pizzas (one thin cheese w tomato and one thin white pizza w spinach) and a nasty chopped salad with wilty iceberg lettuce. Um, no thanks. Wouldnt have even come here if it wasn't for a giftcard my husbands boss gave us for Christmas. This place is garbage. Unfortunately we still have ten bucks left on the card... Grr.
the pasta is great here. WHen u come here i would say to go with one of there specialty pizza the cheeseburger pizza and tostada pizza are great! there red velvet cake is also great to share

I have officially had THREE bad experiences here and I will not go back.  I chalked the first two up to the fact that the place was new and the staff was still getting the hang of things.   My complaint isn't with the food.  In fact, the food has been great every time.  My complaint is with the staff. The hostesses are virtually incompetent and have been every. Single. Time.  Every time I've been in they have been busy and the wait has been around 30-45 minutes.  I've seen tables go empty for as long as 25 minutes (yes, we counted).  If the 17 year olds at the hostess stand weren't so busy texting (true story) and chatting each other up, maybe the wait would be closer to five minutes.  I literally sat on a bench at the front and spotted an empty table.  It stayed empty for 25 minutes.... UNTIL THEY SAT US IN IT.  What the hell were we waiting for??  The hostess to update her Twitter? It's a shame I won't ever go back here, because I really like the food.  The hostess should set the tone for the rest of the evening and if the tone is "ignoring you", I'm not going to bother.

Wow!  I'm really surprised with all of the negative reviews for this CPK.  I have always had great service and food.  This just goes to show that sometimes you should try things for yourself and not always rely on reviews.
This place is pretty good.  I really like their butter cake.  The one problem that stands out is that the pizza is dry.  I have gotten the pizza on occasions and it is very dry.

I come here regularly for lunch for their salads.  I've never had a problem with the service and the food is always excellent (love, love, love the Moroccan Chicken Salad).  I also appreciate the gluten free coding on the menus, I stick to the salads and haven't had an issue yet.

We had a fabulous dinner last night at CPK!  Entered the place with my soon-to-be 8-year old in a serious downer mood.  But only 5 minutes here brightened him up.  Our server, John, was not only attentive but so good-humored that I think my extremely empathetic son had no choice but to follow!  So right there CPK sort of went above-and-beyond to give us a happy dining experience.  Hubby and I started off with drinks.  My Apple Martini was sooo delicious and not too sweet as some can be.  Soon after we ordered our drinks, a manager came by and asked if we would be interested in a few coupons for a free kids' meal next visit.  Of course--I love free food!  Next came our Spinach Dip, which was delicious.  My only complaint here is that you should get a whole lot more for $9.75, but I'm not downgrading my rating because of it.  Kiddies enjoyed their pizza; hubby thought the habanero carnitas pizza super yummy, and I had my favorite caramelized peach salad, this time with yummy marinated salmon.  Everything was good and consistent.  I'd been here before and it was fine, but they've really stepped up their service to compete with newer restaurants like Marston's, and it really shows.  Highly recommended for a fun, splurgy family meal.
Went here a couple of times...the food is very bland and expensive.  I live right across the street and won't go back.  It's a shame, they could have been a big hit.
Standard CPK food with mediocre service.
I am not a big pizza eater to begin with, but this place is not good. There is a lot of hype about it from avid pizza lovers but I am not one of those people. There's not that many non pizza options.

Just tried their steak tacos and they were good. The service was great, but The tortilla soup could have been warmer. The split pea barley, that my boss had, was great. The aspargus soup was a little sweet, but good. The shirmp wraps were cooked perfectly, the lettuce was nice and crisp. The asparagus & spinach spaghetti was nice and fresh. The key lime pie was a perfect ending. Heather, our server was great, she had a great personality and very welcoming.
The price they charge for the quality & quantity of food you get is both insulting & offensive.  I'm amazed this place has been around this long.

I want to start by saying my review as a 2 star is not for the quality of their food. Our food was actually very good. The 2 star is for the quality of the service. We got there on 9/5/11 at about 2pm. We asked to be seated outside. We were their for a little while when our Waiter Melvin took our order. He was pleasant however he did not come back out to fill our drinks and they turned off the misters so it got very hot outside. We ultimately went back inside and they forgot us there. Finally the chef came out with our food and they brought our salads at the exact same time as the main course. The salads should always come first. Then our Waiter finally came back and we said we have no drinks. He asked why we did not bring them in with us. My husband said because they were empty. He asked us what we were drinking and brought them out but NEVER came back to refill them. Over all the experience was poor do to the lack of service. We got out of there at 3:20...1 hour and 20 minutes after we arrived. Very hard with kids including a one year only.

Second time at this location.  The first time took about 2.5 hours since they had only been open a few days...the service was horrible and the food was cold and came out a plate at a time. The second time was up to snuff.  We went for an early dinner and completely missed the crowds.  Service was excellent and the Greek Pizza was very good (although the server should not call it "Greece Pizza" when delivering your food...that would be a whole other thing. I will definitely go to this location more often.

I have eaten at several CPK and never thought much good or bad about the food.  I ate pizza hut a few days before this/visit and I can honestly say there was little difference. The  CPK pizza I had tasted was bland and very similar to many of the $5 pizzas I have had in the past.  Chi Chis is a far better choice if you crave a good pizza.  CPK's pizza tasted like it was from the freezer section at vons.  The pizza was thouroughly dissapointing.
The food and service is always absolutely awesome tasting!  My favorites are the Spaghetti Bolognese and the Waldorf Chicken Salad!  Quality food that always taste frech!

In the beginning of my visits, the service and food was great! But the last time I went, all the kung pao spaghetti we ordered was cold and undercooked. When we called the manager over to our table, the manager came and talked to us about the spaghetti. We told him it was undercooked and cold and he asked us if we wanted another order. What kind of question is that? Obviously if something is not met to one's need, it's your job to offer a replacement. You can't ask such a question to a customer. Honestly, that one time ruined my visits and I haven't been there since, but all the other positive times make up for this one time. So, I'll go back once in a while.

I came here with the hubby for lunch at around noon on a Sunday.  The place wasn't that crowded.  But I knew we were in trouble as soon as we walked inside.  There was no hostess at the hostess stand, and we were standing around there for a good 5 minutes before somebody approached us.  And there were servers milling around us.  Just no acknowledgement of our presence.  After we were seated, it was another 10 minutes before our server showed up to greet us.  She was friendly, alright, but the poor girl seemed very overwhelmed and overworked.  After all, we noticed that she was serving too many tables.  Clearly, this place was understaffed, and their manager was doing nothing to help out.  All he was doing was scratching off those coupon cards for other customers.  Anyway, we didn't even get our complimentary bread, and our pizzas took another 25 minutes to show up, and they were cold too.  Never been to a place with such horrible service.
I love the food here, but the prices are a little hard for us. You can get $50 gift cards from   for $40 which helps a little.

We COULD NOT BELIEVE how HORRIBLE THE SERVICE WAS. We stopped for dinner, requested 3 adults and 2 high chairs. We were told it would be a 20 minute wait. 30 minutes later, we were told it would be 10 minutes more. After another 20 minutes, we were told they were wiping down the table, yet 5 minutes later, we were told that they didn't have high chairs available.  We asked to speak with the manager, Jason S. who was SO RUDE and UNPROFESSIONAL and actually suggested that we sit and have our meal with our babies on our laps....Needless to say, we went elsewhere to eat, and despite it being a busy Friday evening OTHER RESTAURANTS were able to seat us right away, high chairs and all. Not sure if we will ban all CPK's but should have taken advice of others and not bothered with the one in Valencia

Unfortunately after much anticipation of the opening of CPK in Santa Clarita, I was very disappointed.  We stopped for lunch on a Monday afternoon (around 3:00) thinking that we would be able to enjoy a nice lunch being it was a weekday and after lunch rush and before dinner rush, WRONG!!!  First off it took some time for the hostess to actually seat us and we did we waited even longer to get any service!!!  Not even a quick I'll be with you in a minute or water to the table.  I had to ask a waitress who was attending to our table.  She told me she would get someone to help us.  Well guess what?  She was our waitress and she was doing absolutely nothing as we sat waiting for someone to attend to us.  I will never return to this establishment.  I would rather fight the crowds and parking in Burbank any time then return here.
Its a great place. I usually order the chicken and shrimp kungpao spaghetti. I liked it!
